channel.title: Kid Quotes on The Williams Kids – Dillan ♥ Ashley ♥ Dwyane ♥ Bruce
channel.description: Recent content in Kid Quotes on The Williams Kids – Dillan ♥ Ashley ♥ Dwyane ♥ Bruce
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2013-{year} David E. Williams. All rights reserved.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 10, 2019
item.description: Ashley during prayer: .. and thank you God for cartoons that my parents watched thousands and thousands of years ago, and …

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 2, 2019
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, cut both eggs so the yolks can be in love.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 7, 2019
item.description: Lesa checked on Ashley in the shower. Ashley started singing to Lesa: If I had a million dollars, I’d buy you a new house. If I had a million dollars, I’d buy you a new couch. If I had a million dollars, I’d buy you a new love seat. If I had a million dollars, I’d buy you a new…

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 6, 2019
item.description: We saw a wreck on the way home. At bedtime Ashley said: Daddy, I pray you don’t get in a wreck. I would be so sad and lonesome, and I would cry every day for two months, and then I would die too – cause that happens you know. People die from loneliness. Dave: You would maybe be sad but you wouldn’t be alone and I wouldn’t want you to die so young and miss out on your life.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 5, 2019
item.description: Dwyane: I love Daddy half, Mommy half, and God and Jesus half.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 4, 2019
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, we’re best buddies, aren’t we? Dave: Yeah, I suppose we are. Dwyane: Excuuussseee me! Me and Daddy are best buddies! Bruce: No, me and Daddy are best buddies! Dwyane: No, Daddy and me are best buddies, you and Daddy are best pals. Bruce: Okay. Dwyane: Okay then. Bruce, whispering to Dave: Don’t worry, we’re still best buddies – and pals!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 1, 2019
item.description: Dave: Bruce, how was Mr Hudson’s office today? Bruce gave me a thumbs down. Dave: Good. Maybe you’ll think twice before doing that again. Dwyane: Mr Hudson is a spy. Lesa: A spy? Dwyane: He is! He was crawling on the floor. Spying on someone! Lesa: Maybe he dropped something and was looking for it? Dwyane: No, he’s a spy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 27, 2019
item.description: Ashley: How come we don’t go to foster training anymore? Dave: Lesa and I got tired and decided to focus on taking care of you guys the best we can. Besides, we kind of don’t have the room for another foster kid. Ashley: When we get our new place and have the extra room maybe we can get a girl. I think it would be nice to have a girl around.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 26, 2019
item.description: Bruce, for no apparent reason, shouted a quote from Open Season 2: Mr. Weenie! It looks like he’s flying!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 25, 2019
item.description: [A week ago Sunday, Lesa taught Dwyane how to cook scrambled eggs. Lesa instructed, Dwyane cooked. Yesterday morning …] Lesa: Dwyane, what would you like for breakfast? Dwyane: I would like scrambled eggs, but I’m kind of tired of cooking Mommy. Can you make them for me?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 20, 2019
item.description: Ashley: How come we’re not going out to eat? Lesa: In our Marriage Oneness Class we talked about money and budgeting and we decided we eat out too much. Ashley: I hate your Marriage Oneness Class.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 15, 2019
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, can you take us fishing sometime. Dave: Sure. Bruce: Daddy is the only one that ever catches any fish. Dave: Wait, I have to check my license. Bruce: What does that mean. Ashley: It means his fishing license could be out of order. Bruce: Huh? Lesa: It means it might be expired. Bruce: Huh? Dillan: It means it’s not good anymore. Like the expiration date on milk. Lesa: Very good.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 14, 2019
item.description: Ashley: Boy, my mouth is real dry. The dentist sucked up all my spit!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 13, 2019
item.description: Ashley was talking about getting her ears pierced when Dillan said: In Hawaii they don’t pierce their ears. Just their noses and stuff. I bet they come to Indiana and go “Oh my God! They pierce their ears here!”

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 12, 2019
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, can I tell you something? Lesa: Sure. [Bruce walked over and acted like he was going to tell Lesa something but climbed into her lap instead.] Lesa: I thought you wanted to tell me something? Bruce: No, I just wanted to snuggle with you. [I think he kind of did tell her something.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 11, 2019
item.description: Bruce, when getting to a page in his reading book that had a lot of words, said in a whisper: Stay calm. Take a deep breath. [He then read the page flawlessly.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 8, 2019
item.description: Bruce, this morning on the way to daycare: Sunrise! It’s beautiful! Take a picture! It’s been ages!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 7, 2019
item.description: Bruce: I hate birthdays! Except mine. Mine‘s the best!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 6, 2019
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, was I good tonight? Lesa: I didn’t have to yell at you even once. Bruce: Good! If we have a snow day tomorrow then I can stay home with you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 5, 2019
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, can you scratch my back? Dave: Sure. Bruce, about a minute later, and obviously unhappy with my effort, said: Daddy, you can stop. Mommy is the best scratcher backer.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 4, 2019
item.description: Dwyane, to the checkout lady at Jay C’s: Can I tell you something? Checkout lady: Sure. Dwyane: My Mommy has never had a baby.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 31, 2019
item.description: Ashley: I was first. Dillan: No, I was first. Bruce: No, I was first. Dwyane: No, I was first. Dave: You all can’t be first. Kids: Uh-huh!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 30, 2019
item.description: Ashley: Daddy I’m learning about subject pronouns and opinion pronouns. Dave: Opinion pronouns? Ashley: Maybe it’s object pronouns.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 29, 2019
item.description: Ashley: I guess I’ll eat this. I don’t want the expression date to go bad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 28, 2019
item.description: I was doing 60 mph in a 55 mph zone when I passed a patrol car going the opposite way, and said: Oh crap, I hope he doesn’t turn around. All the kids turned their heads to look, and sure enough, the patrol car turned around, and headed back toward us. The kids yelled: He’s turning around! Dave: He’d better hurry or he won’t see which way I’m turning and he’ll have to guess (as I made a left onto 54 toward Bloomfield).

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 25, 2019
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I like and love everyone who lives in this house. Plus God, and Jesus, and Switzie and Porter.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 24, 2019
item.description: Ashley: Daddy I love you. I’m happy. I have a great life.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 23, 2019
item.description: Dwyane: TV gives your brain tumors.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 22, 2019
item.description: Bruce: I know how to spell PE: PE Dillan: But how do you spell TV? Bruce: TV Dillan: You are right!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 18, 2019
item.description: Bruce to Dave: Don’t call her Lesa, call her Mommy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 16, 2019
item.description: Ashley, feigning indignance: Daddy, that guy should have turned his bright lights off! Dave: He should have, but he didn’t. Ashley: That wasn’t nice. It blinded me. After a short pause, Ashley said: Oh well, it’s not a perfect world. Dave: Yup, and people aren’t perfect either. After a much longer pause, Ashley said: I’m kind of glad the world isn’t perfect. If it was I wouldn’t get to be with you guys.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 15, 2019
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, your truck smells like poop again. Dave: I don’t see any cows, someone must have farted. Dwyane: Excuse me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 14, 2019
item.description: Ashley: Did you learn anything at your Marriage Oneness Class? Dave: Yeah, we learned that kids take up all our time, and energy, and money. Ashley: I think you already knew that. Dave: Yes we did. Dwyane: Tony confirmed it for you? Dave: Yup!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 11, 2019
item.description: Dave: Daryl Hall and John Oates. I haven’t heard them for quite a while. Bruce: They’re coming over later.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 10, 2019
item.description: Dwyane: Look, there’s Mommy! Dillan: No, it just looks like Mommy. Bruce: He was driving very fast! Dillan: That’s why it looked like Mommy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 9, 2019
item.description: Bruce: OMG! A flying tree! Other kids: Where? Bruce: Made you look! Ha, ha, ha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 7, 2019
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa as she walked into our bathroom: I wouldn’t go into there if I were you. You might see a naked daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 4, 2019
item.description: Dillan: Dad, were you born in the 1800s?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 3, 2019
item.description: Dave: Are you guys getting ready cause I hear a bunch of chitchating going on in there? Dwyane: Chitchat, chitchat, chitchat, …

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 2, 2019
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, you don’t need a comb. You don’t have any hair.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 28, 2018
item.description: Bruce’s Elf Secret Mission: Pick up your toys without being asked. Bruce’s response: Boy, that’s going to be hard!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 26, 2018
item.description: Dave: Does anyone know where Dwyane’s coat is? Dillan and Ashley: No. Dave: I saw it over here yesterday. Bruce: Maybe it’s an imaginary coat and you just thought you saw it? Dwyane: No, it’s a real coat. Bruce: I didn’t see it. You must have imagined it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 21, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I remember when the dinosaurs were here and there weren’t any houses or cars or roads and there weren’t even any people. Dave: Really? If there wasn’t any people then how did you get there? Bruce: Well, someone told me about it, and that’s how I remember it. Dave: So, you weren’t really there? Bruce: I was there, I just don’t remember being there but I remember the dinosaurs.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 20, 2018
item.description: Dwyane’s prayer: Thank you God for letting mommy cook the salad, the salad that I didn’t get any of, but that’s okay, all mommy’s cooking is good, especially her macaroni. It’s in Jesus’ name I pray. Amen.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 17, 2018
item.description: Bruce to Dwyane: How do you spell Mrs. Mom and I love you?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 31, 2018
item.description: Bruce, when told it was bedtime: I never go to sleep.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 30, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, Mommy and me didn’t fight today. We actually got along for once.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 29, 2018
item.description: Dave: Sorry Bruce, I yelled at the wrong trouble maker. Bruce: That’s okay. I always get in trouble. I’m used to being in trouble. Ha ha ha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 28, 2018
item.description: Ashley: I was the fist person to take a sip out of Daddy’s cup. Bruce: Me too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 27, 2018
item.description: Bruce our 5-year-old informed us: I’m a fight starter, and I can finish them if I want.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 24, 2018
item.description: Annetta, from daycare: I smell poop. Dillan: No it’s just my feet. I didn’t wear socks.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 23, 2018
item.description: Dillan: I’m not sunburned, my ears are cold.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 22, 2018
item.description: Way high up on the water slide platform with Dwyane and Bruce… Bruce: Daddy, if we fell would we die? Dave: Yup, we’d go splat. Dwyane: What if the stairs broke? Dave: We’d die. Bruce: If a big wind came and blew us off? Dave: We’d still die. Dwyane: If there was a hole in the fence and we slipped through? Dave: You’d die. Why don’t you guys say something positive?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 21, 2018
item.description: Dillan: Is Holiday World the biggest park in the world? Bruce: Holiday World is big. It takes up the whole state.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 20, 2018
item.description: Ashley, telling me about the roller coaster: We was screaming. Dillan: I wasn’t. I didn’t even have time to breathe.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 17, 2018
item.description: [We call Ashley DQ – short for drama queen.] Dwyane, to Ashley’s teacher: Ashley, she’s Dairy Queen.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 16, 2018
item.description: Dwyane talking about something: That’s my spot on idea!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 15, 2018
item.description: Bruce, while watching Tom and Jerry, asked: Daddy, is there a super hero one of those? Dave: One of what? Bruce: Tom and Jerry.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 14, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Is that you farting Daddy? Dave: No, it’s the motorcycle in front of us.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 13, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Bruce has a butt problem. [No clue why.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 10, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy can you take a picture of me sleeping so I know which way I should lay?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 9, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Do they do the hokie pokie in jail?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 8, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Use your turn signals stupid! Ashley: That’s not very nice to say. They might not be able to afford turn signals.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 7, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Look at me. I’m flying! Dillan: That’s not flying. That’s running and jumping with your arms out and falling. Bruce: Un-uh. I’m flying.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 3, 2018
item.description: At the doctor office Dwyane said: Daddy, Ashley is trying to play with this and I was here first! Dave: Dwyane, if some little girl you didn’t know came up and started playing with that would you share, or would you tell me some little girl wanted to play with that but you were there first? Dwyane: I’d share. Dave: Then why won’t you share with Ashley? Dwyane: Ashley’s a big girl – not little.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 2, 2018
item.description: Ashley singing: Boys go to Jupiter to get more stupider! Girls go to college to get more smarter!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 1, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Goodnight, and don’t let the bed bites bug you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 31, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, Dwyane choked me! Dave: Dwyane! Did you choke Bruce? Dwyane: Bruce was choking me! Dave: Bruce! Did you choke Dwyane? Bruce: Yeah … but he choked me back!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 30, 2018
item.description: Ashley to Lesa: Can you add some flavor to this popcorn? Lesa: Daddy brought that popcorn back from Mishawaka just for you. Ashley: It’s the best popcorn ever!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 27, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, I don’t think it’s Dwyane’s birthday today. Lesa: Yes, Dwyane’s birthday is today. Bruce: I don’t think he’s six today. Lesa: Why do you say that Bruce? Bruce: He’s not any bigger. [I overlooked posting this. Dwyane’s birthday was July 17.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 26, 2018
item.description: [The kids get anxious when Lesa or I have to travel. They worry we won’t come back and they’ll loose us. Ashley is the worst. She has bad dreams like car wrecks and fires – things that would keep us from coming back.] Ashley: Daddy, I’m having those bad dreams again. Dave: Which ones? Ashley: The one where there’s a fire and you and Mommy don’t wake up and die and I’m all alone.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 24, 2018
item.description: Ashley talking about me going on a business trip: Daddy, it’s going to be like you die and then come back to life after three days – just like Jesus.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 23, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Your truck sounds very rusty.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 13, 2018
item.description: Dwyane, when we were talking about acting our age, said: I act like a lower case Dillan – with a little ‘d’.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 12, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: I put my over easy egg on my toast to make over easy toast.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 11, 2018
item.description: Sitting around the campfire at camp, a very tired Ashley asked: Daddy, can you walk me up (to the Yurt) so I don’t fall asleep on the way?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 10, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: We’re a pooping family cause when we got back to camp we all pooped.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 9, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Why are we on a gravel road? Dave: Uh ……. Dwyane: Are we lost? Dave: Yes. Yes we are.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 3, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, can we sing Happy Birthday to Dillan again? Lesa: Why? Dwyane: Because it’s Dillan’s birthday and I like his birthday. Lesa: You can sing Happy Birthday to him anytime you want. [Dwyane sings Happy Birthday to Dillan again.] Dillan: All this Happy Birthday singing is getting annoying. They sang to me at church too. Lesa: They knew it was your birthday? Ashley: Yeah, he was going around telling everybody.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 2, 2018
item.description: Dave, to Bruce (who was in a hurry to get to Kindergarten Countdown): So, you want to be with Ms. Page more than me? Bruce: Fine! I’ll hug and kiss you.

item.title: Adult Quote of the Day – June 29, 2018
item.description: Lesa: I just love our kids!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 28, 2018
item.description: Bruce, talking about our Amazon Echo: Alexa, I love you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 27, 2018
item.description: Ashley: I took all the corn. Lesa: Them chickens are going to be unhappy. Ashley: I’d rather have a full belly over happy chickens. Lesa: And I’d rather you eat it than the chickens!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 26, 2018
item.description: Dave: Quiet! Bruce: Why? Dave: Don’t y’all know the meaning of quiet? Bruce: No.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 25, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, is Asian Pearl expensive? Dillan sure picked a fancy, fancy restaurant to go to!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 20, 2018
item.description: Dillan: Does water sweat?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 19, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, do you know what country music is?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 18, 2018
item.description: Lesa: Bruce, tablet time is over. Bruce: Wait! I want to keep going up so I can meet Jesus. Lesa: Bruce, there’s no Jesus in Minecraft.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 14, 2018
item.description: Dave: Did you see that horse laying down sleeping? Lesa: That’s kind of unusual to see. Dave: Did you know horses can snooze standing up? Ashley: Do they sleep and walk? Dave: No. Ashley: They can’t sleep and walk, but I do!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 13, 2018
item.description: Ashley to Dillan. What am I? Dillan: Ummmm, a beautiful girl? Ashley, after a pause, said: Why thank you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 12, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Dwayne has a crush on a lot of girls: Kenzley, Little Lily, Big Lily, Little Madison, Elin, Clara, and Jorydan. Dave: And I bet they like him too. Ashley: No. Dillan: They all follow him around and then he picks his nose and eats it. Ashley: They don’t follow him, he follows them, and they run away because they think he’s gross!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 11, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: My taste buds changed today. They like pizza rolls now.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 8, 2018
item.description: Ashley while eating soup: It’s interesting that the soup keeps getting lower while I’m eating.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 7, 2018
item.description: Ashley: If you had 50 L.O.L. Dolls and a friend came over, you would have 25 L.O.L. Dolls for the friend and 25 L.O.L. Dolls for you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 6, 2018
item.description: While playing cars Dillan said to Bruce: This one is a police car. Bruce: Then why doesn’t it have sirens? Dillan: It’s an undercover police car. Bruce: Well, I hate black. It hurts my head. Get a different color. Dillan: Okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 5, 2018
item.description: Bruce: There are too many babies at daycare – thousands of them.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 31, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: I love Ashley almost with my whole heart.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 30, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, I mucus-ed myself. I was asleep, and it must have been in my mouth, and I didn’t know it, and then my mouth opened, and I mucus-ed myself – from here to here [showing me where on his pajamas]. Dave: That’s alright Dwyane. That happens sometimes. You don’t have to worry about it. It’ll wash out just fine.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 29, 2018
item.description: Dwyane to Pauline McGuire: Schools weren’t invented yet when Mommy and Daddy were little.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 25, 2018
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, there’s this diet called South Beach Diet where you can eat and eat and the pounds just go away. You should try it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 24, 2018
item.description: Ashley: I’ve got everything in my bag I need: sunglasses, diary, pen, whoopee cushion.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 23, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Fog is because a cloud broke open and it spilled out all over.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 22, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, it’s unbearable having to wait to see what I get for my birthday. Can’t you please tell me just one thing you’re going to get me? Dave: Yeah, I see your point. It must be hard waiting. Okay, I’ll tell you one thing you’re going to get. You’re getting a … a card! Ashley: Daddy! That’s no fair!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 21, 2018
item.description: Dave: I wouldn’t try to ramp that. Looks like a broken arm, leg, or head to me. Dwyane: It’s too scary. Bruce: Nooo! I’ll do it!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 18, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, let me pick your shirts out. Dave: What for? Ashley: You always wear those boring grey, blue and brown shirts. Dave: That’s because I’m not a seven, almost eight, little girl – I’m a boring old man. Besides, I like grey. Ashley: No, you need something brighter. [She goes in my room and comes back with my most gawdiest shirt.] Like this one! Long story short, guess what shirt I’m wearing?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 17, 2018
item.description: Lesa to Dwyane: Are you blowing your boogers out so Porter will lick them? Dwyane: Yes. Lesa: Well, quit it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 16, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Bruce’s birthday is soon. Dave: Yes it is! He’ll be five. Dwyane: And I’ll be six!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 15, 2018
item.description: Bruce: For my birthday I want a huge Nerf gun, a trailer like Dillan has and the front [semi-trailer and cab], and a LEGO Police City, and a Mountain Dew car. Dave: You have to be 8 for the LEGO Police City and I don’t think they make Mountain Dew cars anymore. Bruce: Then for Christmas. The REAL Christmas. Santa will make it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 14, 2018
item.description: I avoided hitting a 6′ Black snake sunning itself on the road on our way home from camping and Bruce asked : Why is he laying in the road? Lesa: Because the road is the warmest place in the woods right now. He’s cold blooded so when it’s cold he get’s cold. The road is warm so he gets warm. Dillan: Daddy, can snakes live in trees? Dave: Yes. Dillan: Can they live in caves?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 10, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Eww! Dillan just picked a booger and ate it and wiped his finger on my shirt! Dave: If he ate it then nothing got on your shirt. Ashley: But he got his booger juice on me! Dillan: Daddy, is there such a thing as booger juice? Dave: I suppose it depends on the booger. Ashley: That’s just disgusting!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 9, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy! Ashley stepped on me! Ashley: I didn’t! Dave: Then why is he crying? Ashley: I accidentally stepped on him – accidentally. Dave: Yeah, right. Ashley: I didn’t see him! Dave: Girl, you better watch where you’re walking! Ashley: Okay. Dave: Bruce, are you okay? Bruce: Yeah, she’s a meanie.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 7, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: I got two scoops of ice cream. Ashley: Mommy, can I have three scoops of ice cream? Lesa: No. Bruce: I have to infinity and beyond scoops. Dwyane: That would be over the house and to the city ice cream. Bruce: Yeah.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 4, 2018
item.description: Dave: Ashley, it’s time to get up. Ashley: When? Dave: Now. Ashley: No. Dave: You have to. Ashley: Why? Dave: You have to go to school. Ashley: No I don’t. Dave: Yes you do. Ashley: I don’t want to. Dave: You have to go to school. It’s the law. Ashley: Oh, okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 3, 2018
item.description: As we drove to daycare after the other kids got on the bus, Bruce said: Daddy, I like Dwyane and Dillan and Ashley. Dave: You do? I like them too. And I like you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 2, 2018
item.description: Doctor to Dave: When was his last bowel movement? Dave: After dinner, about an hour ago. Bruce: Daddy, what’s a bowel movement? Dave whispering to Bruce: They want to know when you pooped. Bruce, jumping up and raising his hand, said: I pooped two times!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 1, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, do you want to sit on the moon? Dave: Not really. Bruce: Why not? Dave: It’s very high and very far away. Bruce But I want to see you sitting on the moon. Dave: Maybe someday Bruce but not today. Bruce: Okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 30, 2018
item.description: Dave: You better listen to your Mom! Bruce: You’re not the boss! Dillan and Ashley: Oh yes he is! Lesa: Bruce, you’d better listen. Bruce: Okay. Dave: And so it begins…

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 27, 2018
item.description: Lesa: Bruce, you have your very own lunch box. Ashley: I need a new one too. Lesa: No, I found yours. Ashley: Where? Lesa: In the pantry underneath a bunch of stuff. Dillan: Oh, I remember! It fell when I got mine that one time. Lesa: Well thanks for picking it up and putting it back where it belonged. Dwyane: Thank you Dillan. Bruce: Thanks Dillan. Ashley: Yeah, thanks Dillan.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 26, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, am I a famous dancer? Dave: You’re a good dancer and you have all the moves but I don’t think you’re famous yet. I bet someday. Dwyane: Mommy, do I got the moves? Lesa: Do you ever! You have the moves!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 25, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, what is that delicious smell? [It was a pork roast.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 24, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, will Mommy be awake when we get home? Dave: Yes. Bruce: But is it late? Dave: Yes, but it’s not our bedtime yet so she’ll be awake. Why? Bruce: Cause I want to hug and kiss her.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 23, 2018
item.description: Bruce: I want a break from daycare and church. Lesa: Sounds like you need a vacation. Bruce: Yes, a vacation.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 20, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, can I tell you something? Dave: Sure. Bruce: I love and like you. Dave: I love and like you too!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 19, 2018
item.description: Ashley to Bruce: I remember when you got out of the tub and was dripping wet and slipped and fell and broke your head – and you died. But then God decided to bring you back again – I don’t know why.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 18, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Where are we going? Dave: We’re taking Dillan, Ashley and Dwyane to school and you to daycare. Bruce: The new daycare? Dave: The new daycare in the old building until they get moved into the new building. Bruce: [BIG SIGH] It’s so complicated.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 17, 2018
item.description: Dillan: I don’t want to move. I like going to my school. Dave: Well, we need the space, you need a room, and if we can stay close to here we will. Dillan: Can we just add a room on so I can keep my friends? Dave: I don’t know what we’ll do yet. But you know what, no matter what we do, God will help take care of us. Dillan: God is already taking care of us.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 16, 2018
item.description: Dave: Who farted? Ashley: Excuse me. Dave: That was nasty smelling. Dillan: Nasty smelling like the trash Daddy and me hauled Saturday. Were you eating garbage? Ashley: No, it must have been the school lunch. Dillan: I only ate the taco meat and I farted all day! Dwyane: Not me! I waited until I got outside and I farted so loud – and so long – it was crazy loud and long!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 13, 2018
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, if you need a few dollars of mine to buy a new house that’s okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 12, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, can we watch a movie? Lesa: Not right now. Bruce: Mommy, can we go in the other room and talk about it?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 11, 2018
item.description: Ashley: How come the boys want to be with Mommy the most? Dave: For some reason, daughters like their dads the most, and sons like their moms the most. Ashley: Did Mommy like her dad too? Dave: Mommy loves her dad but he is gone so she doesn’t get to see and talk to him anymore. It’s very sad. Ashley: She can still talk to him and he will hear her in Heaven.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 10, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I see a roller coaster! Dave: I don’t see one? I see a logging truck. Bruce: That’s what I meant.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 4, 2018
item.description: Dave: I have to figure out taxes after adopting you kids. Dillan: You must have years of practice.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 3, 2018
item.description: [Ashley was chastising Dillan for something he did a couple of years ago.] Dave: What are you going to do? Blame him for the rest of his life. Ashley: Yes.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 2, 2018
item.description: Ashley: What is a groom? Dave: That is what they call the husband. Don’t ask me why. Dillan and Ashley: Why?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 26, 2018
item.description: Lesa to Bruce: You shyster. Bruce: I know, I’m doing my job.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 23, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Is your underwear white, or green? Dave: Uh?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 22, 2018
item.description: Ashley: She was playing with my best friend and she wasn’t very nice. She was mean to me. Dave: Sounds like she’s a bit of a bully. Bruce: I’m a bully too. Dave: We don’t like bullies. Bruce: I’m not!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 21, 2018
item.description: Bruce, pointed at the strawberry shortcake Lesa made for dessert, and said: I’ll take that piece!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 20, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Hey Daddy, did you know that I’ve been growing up? Dave: Yes, I did! Isn’t it awesome! Bruce: Yeah.   Bruce: Daddy? Dave: What? Bruce: I don’t really want to grow up.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 16, 2018
item.description: Dave to the kids: You have to let Bruce play LEGOs with you too. You can’t shut the door and not let him join in. That’s mean. Ashley: We was letting him play. We made a LEGO family. Dave: Is Dillan in the LEGO family? Ashley: Yes. Dave: Is Dwyane in the LEGO family? Ashley: Yes. Dave: Are you in the LEGO family? Ashley: Yes. Dave: Is Bruce in the LEGO family?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 15, 2018
item.description: Dave: I should go in there and whip his butt. Bruce: You can’t say that. Dave: I’m an adult and I can say what I want. Bruce: You can’t say that! You’re supposed to say pickle pants. Dave: Okay Bruce. I should go in there and whip his pickle pants.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 14, 2018
item.description: [Bruce had blue paint on his hands from making a leprechaun trap and asked to ride his bike.] Dave: Don’t forget to leave enough energy to bring your bike back up when you’re done riding. Bruce: Don’t worry. I have super energy because I’m blue. Then he ran out the door and yelled boo-ya!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 13, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, what is A+C? Dave: I don’t know. Ashley: Why not? You’re an adult.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 12, 2018
item.description: Lesa was following us in the Jeep. Bruce said: Eat our dust Mommy!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 6, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: I’m going to set my leprechaun trap by the window, and when he comes out of the woods at night, I’m going to wake up and jump on him and take his money bag! I’m going to catch that leprechaun!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 5, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: Can we build a tree house on top of the house? Dave: No, that would be a house house and not a tree house. Dwyane: I want a house house.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 2, 2018
item.description: Dwyane during prayer last night: And God, guess what? I love you. Thank you for making me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 1, 2018
item.description: At Asian Pearl Ashley carefully examined each Fortune Cookie and took a long time before selecting one, and said: I’m being very careful so I can pick one with a good fortune. [She picked a cookie that had two fortunes!]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 28, 2018
item.description: Ashley: When I call them [on her toy phone] they [the boys] won’t answer. Dave: Maybe they can’t hear the phone ringing? Ashley: No, they hear me calling. Dave: Maybe they can’t get to the phone? Ashley: No, the phone is right next to them. Dave: Well, maybe they don’t want to talk to you? Ashley: No, that doesn’t make any sense. Dave: Well, maybe they don’t know what to say?

item.title: Adult Quote of the Day – February 27, 2018
item.description: Dave, commenting on the clerk at the clothing store: That girl looked really scared. I think she thought we was all coming in.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 26, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, can I clean up the bathroom?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 23, 2018
item.description: Bruce sneezed, Lesa said: Bless you. Bruce in reply: You’re welcome.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 22, 2018
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, do you know big Ashley? Not big Ashley our neighbor but big Ashley at Scouts. Her baby was crying and I went by her and said “Hi” and she quit crying. And then she started crying again so I took off my necklace, I didn’t give it to her, I just took it off and let her watch me play with it, and she stopped crying again. Daddy, i got a gift with babies.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 21, 2018
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, were you alive during the Gold Rush?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 20, 2018
item.description: Dave: Bruce, you get 4 minutes in timeout. Bruce: 5! Dave: Okay, 5. Bruce: 6! Dave: Okay, 6. Bruce: 7! Dave: How about 10? Bruce: Okay. Dave: 10 it is. Bruce: Okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 13, 2018
item.description: Dillan, after reading his “I Survived” book: Daddy, a boy got burned up and survived. Dave: Getting burned hurts, and it leaves scars that don’t go away [I showed him my burn scar on my leg]. Dave: And some stupid people will make fun of that kid for the way he looks, and they won’t even care how much it hurt when he got burned, and they won’t care about his feelings either.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 12, 2018
item.description: Bruce: I love you Daddy. Dave: I love you too. Bruce: What’s your name? Ha ha ha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 9, 2018
item.description: As we drove by the church in Indy where we were married over 35 years ago, Lesa said to the kids: That’s the church Daddy and me got married in. Bruce: Why?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 7, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Dwyane is a pondo because he sits sideways. Lesa: What’s a pondo? Bruce, sounding annoyed: A hippo! Lesa, sounding confused: Oh, okay?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 6, 2018
item.description: Dave: Bruce! Don’t jump off the bed like that! You’ll break an arm or something! Bruce: You can glue it back on with that hot glue stuff.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 5, 2018
item.description: Lesa: Ashley, can you put a Pop-Tart in for Dwyane? Dwyane: No! I can fix my it! Mommy, you need to show me first.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 2, 2018
item.description: At prayer time Lesa told Dwyane: I’ll hold your arm because it looks like you just picked a booger and ate it. Dwyane: No! I was just trying to get my toenail unstuck from my teeth.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 1, 2018
item.description: [Driving home we saw two young bulls butting heads.] Dillan: It looks like they’re fighting. Dave: They are. Ashley: Probably fighting over a girl. Dave: Sounds about right. Dillan: Daddy, do you always have to fight to get the girl? Dave: Not always, but sometimes. Dillan: Daddy: Did you fight to get Mommy? Dave: I sure did! I had to fight to get her, and I had to fight to keep her!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 31, 2018
item.description: Hair stylist to Bruce: Are you the baby brother? Bruce: No! Hair stylist: Are you the littlest brother? Bruce: Yes.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 30, 2018
item.description: [We were watching Little House on the Prairie on the Hallmark Channel and a commercial came on …] Ashley: Daddy, there are some girls that are for sale – at farmers only dot com. Dave: They’re not for sale Ashley. Ashley: Well, you can get them to marry you if you want. Dave: That’s probably true.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 29, 2018
item.description: Bruce, being super serious, told Dwyane: I took my coat off! I’m not playing around!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 26, 2018
item.description: Ashley, not wanting to be outrun by Dwyane, yelled: Stop it! Daddy said no running in the house!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 25, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I only have night dreams when I close my eyes.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 24, 2018
item.description: Driving to Indy Dwyane asked Bruce: What’s outside your window? Bruce replied: A house. Dwyane: We got trash.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 23, 2018
item.description: Me, to Ashley, at my Dad’s house: It’s my Dad’s birthday. He just turned 79 years old today. Ashley: That’s pretty old. How old is your mom? Dave: I think she’s 33, maybe 34. My Mom, overhearing, said: No, I’m 39. Ashley, looking closely at my Mom, said: No, you’re not 39. You’re a lot older!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 22, 2018
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, where do babies come out from? Dave: You should ask Mommy. Dillan: From their butt! Dwyane: Eww! Ashley: I know! Dave: Bruce, go ask Mommy. Don’t listen to these guys. Dillan: From their mouth! Dave: Go ask Mommy. Bruce: Mommy, how do babies get out of bellies? Ashley: I know! I know! Lesa: From their vaginas. Ashley: I knew that. Dwyane: What’s that? Lesa: You know how boys have penises?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 19, 2018
item.description: Dwyane: When I grow up I’ll live in a hotel forever. Lesa: Hopefully you’ll grow into a young man and get a job to support yourself and get an apartment or a house. Ashley: That’s when I’ll find me a man. Dave: You don’t have to. You can get a job and maybe go to college like Dwyane. Ashley: Okay, I’ll just walk around and look pretty. Dillan: That might catch you some boys.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 18, 2018
item.description: Dillan: The chicken tastes good with the potatoes. Dave: What chicken? Dillan: What kind of chicken is it? Dave: What chicken? Ashley: That’s not chicken – it’s meat. Lesa: It’s pork.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 17, 2018
item.description: Bruce: I’m bored. Lesa: Go play. Bruce: Hey, I know! The kitty litter box needs cleaned out.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 16, 2018
item.description: Dillan, after we finished sledding: Wow, I can’t feel my butt anymore.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 15, 2018
item.description: Dillan, showing me his drawing: Daddy, I drew the Titanic and the ice cube. Dave: That’s a nice drawing. Ashley, butting into the conversation: Dillan, it wasn’t an ice cube, it was a rock. Dave: It was an iceberg and it’s still a nice drawing.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 12, 2018
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa: I said a bad word and I already put soap in my mouth.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 11, 2018
item.description: Bruce, when we told him to stop: What? I didn’t do nothing.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 10, 2018
item.description: Dillan: Guys, I really want to be left alone. Ashley: That’s why we’re bothering you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 9, 2018
item.description: Dwyane, as I was leaving daycare, yelled: Goodbye Daddy! Have a good time at work!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 8, 2018
item.description: Bruce, at the dinner table, trying to upset Ashley whose favorite animal is a rabbit: Do you know what my favorite animal is? Bruce, before anyone could respond: Foxes eating bunnies! Ha, ha, ha! Bruce: Why did the bunny cross the road? Dave and Lesa: Why? Bruce: To get hit by a car! Ha, ha, ha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 4, 2018
item.description: Dave: So far today we’ve passed David Street and David Road signs. If I see a David Williams sign I’m going to stop and take it. Bruce: Who’s David? Ashley: That is Daddy. His name is David. Bruce: No. Dave: Bruce, my name is David. Bruce: I thought your name was only Daddy – Daddy Williams.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 3, 2018
item.description: Dwyane, yesterday, in a pleading voice: Mommy, when are we going back to school?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 2, 2018
item.description: Dwyane and Bruce blowing into each others face: I can see my breath, can you?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 22, 2017
item.description: Ashley, to the boys: You’re not in the contest. Besides, I would win anyway.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 21, 2017
item.description: The boys woke up before light and were in their room playing with the door closed. Lesa saw the bathroom light was on and turned it off. The boys noticed the bathroom light wasn’t shining under their door anymore and it got really quiet in their room. Then Lesa heard Dwyane say: Remember, God is with you, God is with you. Then the door cracked open, and Bruce slowly stuck his head out the door.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 20, 2017
item.description: Ashley, tapping her feet to the Christmas music at dinner: My feet are talented. Lesa: My toes are talented! I can pick up LEGOs with them! Ashley: Mine are too! I can pick up TWO LEGOs with these two toes right here (she put her feet on the table to show us which toes). Dave and Lesa: Get your feet off the table! [Ashley got down from the table and demonstrated by picking up two LEGOs.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 19, 2017
item.description: Dillan, on the way to Scouts: Daddy, I love and like you. Dave: I love and like you too. Dillan: You’re the best. Dave: Well, thanks Dillan. A lot of kids probably think their dad is the best. They can’t all be the best. I’m probably just an okay dad. Dillan: No, you are the best. That’s my opinion. Dave: Thanks Dillan! Dillan: Do you know why you’re the best? Dave: No, why?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 18, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Blah, blah, blah. Ashley: Daddy, can you make Dillan stop saying blah, blah, blah? Dave: Dillan, why are you saying that? Ashley: Cause I was singing. Dave: Dillan, stop aggravating Ashley. Dillan: Well, she needs to get better at singing.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 15, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I wish we had a house boat. Dave: Me too. Bruce: And a house car. Dave: Me too!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 14, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, I got you two coloring sheets for Christmas. Dave: Don’t tell me, I don’t want to know. I want to be surprised. Ashley: Yeah, but you don’t know what kind. Dave: Well, okay. Speaking of Christmas, what should we get Mommy? Dillan and Ashley both shouted: JEWELRY! Bruce: A ring with a big sparkly thing on it. Dave: Besides jewelry what can we get her? Bruce: Peace and quiet!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 13, 2017
item.description: Dave: You guys are being rotten! I should take you to Pet Smart and sell you to people who want new pets. Dwyane: You can’t sell us because it’s closed! Nana nana boo boo! Bruce: We’re adopted so you can’t get rid of us. You have to keep us forever! That’s the rule.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 12, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I wouldn’t want to be a deer – they get shooted. Dave: People can get shot but I’d rather be a person than a deer too. Bruce: If a deer knocked at our door I would open it and shoot it. Dwyane: You’d shoot a baby deer? Bruce: No, a daddy deer. I would shoot it – and eat it!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 11, 2017
item.description: Coming home from church Ashley must have said at least ten times: Daddy, Dwyane did … [insert some perceived wrong]. Dwyane countered each and every one of Ashley’s claims by saying: Daddy, Ashley did … [insert some perceived wrong] … too. And she did it first! Bruce: Daddy? Dave: What Bruce? Are you going to tattle tale on someone too? Bruce: No! Dillan quickly said: I will! Dave: So Bruce, what were you going to say?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 8, 2017
item.description: Dave, after putting Christmas lights on the house: Bruce, what do you think of the Christmas lights? Bruce: I think Santa will like it so much he’ll want to stay here.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 7, 2017
item.description: After Lesa kissed and hugged Dwyane, said goodbye and wished him a good day, he said (while doing a fist pump in the air): Yes! I will have a GREAT day! It’s the Zipping Contest today! YES!!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 6, 2017
item.description: Pauline: Dwyane, what was your favorite Thanksgiving food? Dwyane: The bad eggs. Pauline: Do you mean deviled eggs? Dwyane: Yes.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 5, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, in the truck, coming back from the Bedford Christmas Parade: I just farted to infinity and beyond.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 4, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, giving Lesa his Sunday School project: Wait, there’s something else in there! There’s candy. Lesa: I don’t see any candy. Dwyane: Oh yeah, I already ate it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 1, 2017
item.description: When we walked into daycare some kid yelled: Here come the Williamses! I’m still not used to hearing that.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 30, 2017
item.description: Dillan tentatively poked his head around the bathroom door while I was on the toilet and said: Daddy? Dave: Dillan? What do you need? Is it an emergency? Dillan: Daddy, I like and love you. Dave: I like and love you too. [Dillan took off running. I guess he felt the need to tell me that just then.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 29, 2017
item.description: Bruce, stood at the top of the deck, struck a super-hero pose, and sounded a bit maniacal as he yelled: Top of the world! Ha, ha, ha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 28, 2017
item.description: Bruce, at dinner: If you roll your eyes your eyes will get stuck in the back of your head. Dillan: If you cross your eyes they’ll get stuck too. Bruce the next morning: Oh, by the way Miss Courtney, it is true about the rolling your eyes thing.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 27, 2017
item.description: Dave: Ashley, do you want to go to the grocery store with Lesa or to Lowe’s with me? Ashley: Daddy, I’ve spent my whole life going places with you. Ever since I’ve known you. I’ve only been someplace with Mommy one time! I want to go with Mommy. Dave: Just one place huh? Okay, you better go with Mommy then. Ashley: Don’t worry Daddy, I still love you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 22, 2017
item.description: Dave: Is that the same Jordyn that Dillan likes? Ashley: Yeah, but he doesn’t like her anymore. Dave: He’ll probably always like her a little bit. Ashley: So when she grows up and gets married to another boy Dillan will be sad? Dave: I doubt it. He’ll probably like another girl by then. Ashley, incredulously: He will? Dave: Of course he will. There are plenty of fish in the sea. Ashley: I’ve heard that before.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 21, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, roll down the windows – Dillan farted. Dillan: I did not! Besides, the smeller is the feller. Ashley: The feller is never the smeller – but only sometimes. Dave: What? I’m confused. The smeller is never the feller – but only sometimes? Ashley: Right. Dave: So … are you saying when you’re the smeller you’re not the feller, but if someone else is the smeller they are the feller?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 20, 2017
item.description: Ashley: My hair is the softest part of my hair. Dave: Your hair is the softest part of your hair? That doesn’t make any sense. Ashley: I mean the inside of my hair is softer than the outside. Dave: You can feel the inside of your hair? That’s weird. Ashley: Daddy! I mean the hair by my neck is the softest part!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 17, 2017
item.description: Ashley: I can say “who are you” in a foreign language. Dave: Oh yeah? Go ahead. Ashley: Who art thou? Spelled w-h-o a-r-t t-h-o-u. Dave: What language is that? Ashley: I don’t remember, I forgot.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 16, 2017
item.description: Lesa during our spaghetti dinner: Daddy can cook too you know. Ashley: He makes good pancakes. Lesa: He can make good spaghetti too. Remember he made spaghetti when I went to Wisconsin? Dillan: Yeah, but not as good as Mommy! Mommy has a secret sauce called “Mommy” that gets into everything and makes it taste yummy!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 15, 2017
item.description: Bruce, looking for the laminator: Miss Courtney needs a maninator. Miss Jessica: We all need a maninator.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 14, 2017
item.description: While going through Dwyane’s weekly reading test results, Lesa said: Dwyane, we need to read your books more, and you need to start sounding out words. Dwyane, handing Lesa his neatly written ABC’s, said: Here, look at this. This should make you happier.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 13, 2017
item.description: Dillan, after tornado cleanup: Daddy, we did a good deed, didn’t we? Ashley, after tornado cleanup: I wish we could help more people. Dave, after tornado cleanup: I’m getting old. I’m sore all over.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 10, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Your beard is soft. Can I have one for my next birthday?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 9, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, thanks for building the swingset. Dave: You’re welcome. I’ve noticed you guys don’t play on it much anymore. Bruce: That’s because of all the bugs. Dave: The world is full of bugs. There are even bugs in the house. I wouldn’t let bugs stop me from having fun. Bruce: But these are outside bugs like spiders, grasshoppers, lizards, butterflies, and bees. Ashley: Butterflies aren’t bad. Dave: Lizards aren’t bad either, or bees, or grasshoppers.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 8, 2017
item.description: Lesa, to Ashley after Hope Harvest: What did you have at Steak ‘n’ Shake? Ashley: A hamburger and cheese, and fries, and a chocolate shake with no cherry. Lesa: Did you order it that way? Ashley: Yeah. Lesa: Did you at least get whipped cream? Ashley: Yeah, I have to have whipped cream or I will die.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 7, 2017
item.description: While playing the Trolls soundtrack, when a slow song (Hello) came on, Bruce said: Daddy, can you skip this song? It makes my head hurt!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 3, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, I could smell the bacon and eggs all the way down by the truck because my nose grew while you weren’t looking so I could smell them.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 2, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, my head hurts. Can you check it? Dave, feeling her forehead: Not hot at all. Feels kind of cool if you ask me. Ashley: Maybe it has frostbite? Dave: No, no frostbite. Ashley: I meant frostbite on the inside of my head. Dave: That’s entirely possible.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 1, 2017
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa after accidentally losing Dillan’s Halloween straw: Don’t tell Dillan that I lost it. Tell him Bruce did it because I’m not that bad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 31, 2017
item.description: Dave: Bruce, go get your bike. Bruce: But a coyote might eat me.. Dave: No, you won’t be eaten. Coyotes don’t usually eat people. Bruce: They like meat and I’m meat! Dave: You make a good point there but I think you’ll be okay. Dwyane: They won”t eat you that fast cause you’re too big. They will only eat a leg or something. Dave: Right, I bet he feels better now.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 30, 2017
item.description: While Lesa was cooking dinner Ashley said: Mmmm, I love that! [… a long pause…] What is it?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 27, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, acting surprised: Mommy, your name is Lesa?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 26, 2017
item.description: Looking at the litter box, Bruce asked: Did the dogs do that? Dave: No. Bruce: Who did that then? Dave: Did what? Bruce: Poop in there. Dave: Pleasant. [Our cat.] Bruce: You mean cats poop‽ I didn’t know that. Why?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 25, 2017
item.description: Bruce, got down from the dinner table, walked over to me, and in a hushed and serious voice said: Daddy, if you lived on a skyscraper and jumped off you would die.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 24, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy and Daddy have cooties. They’re married.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 23, 2017
item.description: Lesa to the kids: Abraham Lincoln was born in Kentucky. Ashley: Abraham Lincoln should have been the first president. Dave: George Washington was a pretty good president too. Ashley: Was George Washington one of the presidents when you guys was alive?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 13, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Who’s coming to visit? Dave: Our friends Dennis and Tricia. Bruce: Who is that? Dave: You remember them. We went to their house and had a bonfire a little while ago. They have the cows. Bruce: Oh yeah, I remember them. Are they bringing the cows too? Dave: Maybe, but the cows’ll have to stay on the deck. They can’t come in the house. Ashley: Those cows were the sneaky kind of cows.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 12, 2017
item.description: Dillan, giving brotherly advice to Dwyane: In school, in first grade, Mrs. Wronowicz says you’re not allowed to say “I can’t.” Ashley: You can’t even say cannot!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 11, 2017
item.description: Ashley, talking about her bio-parents: They hurt Dillan more on the inside where you can’t see, and they hurt me more on the outside where you can see.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 9, 2017
item.description: Ashley who is selling Girl Scout chocolates handed me the order form and said: Daddy, I only need fifty-five more dollars to get a small bunny prize. What are you going to buy?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 6, 2017
item.description: Bruce, being totally serious: Daddy, you don’t ever want to squeeze what is called testicles because it hurts, and you won’t want to even move! Dave, being serious back: Is that so? Well, that’s good to know. Lesa: And it can keep you from helping to have babies when you get married. Bruce: I don’t want any babies! They have poopy pants!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 5, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, I haven’t hugged and kissed you all day. I need to hug and kiss you right now!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 4, 2017
item.description: Bruce: I like squirrels – except when they attack you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 3, 2017
item.description: Ashley: If you eat ice cream too fast you get brain freeze. Dwyane: And if you pee real quick you’ll get pee freeze!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 2, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Mommy. Mommy. Mommy! Mommmmmy!! Bruce: Daddy, do you know where Mommy is? Dillan: She’s in Heaven. Dave: She’s probably out by the chicken coup getting eggs and stuff. Bruce: The coyotes probably got her cause I yelled out there already. Dillan: I told you she’s in Heaven.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 29, 2017
item.description: Ashley, telling me all about the bad things that have happened to her: Daddy, I’ve been hit in the face by four different kinds of balls. One was the squishy kind at gym, and it hurt. And I’ve wrecked on my bike. And I’ve been hit with [toy] cars and [toy] trucks, and I’ve been kicked and hit and pinched by all the boys, and I was pushed off the bed and snapped my neck, and I’ve been pushed down the stairs and fell down the stairs too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 28, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, a leaf just hit your window. Dave: What! Of all the …! How dare that leaf hit my truck! Some nerve! I’m going back right now and spankling that leaf! Bruce: But Daddy, you’ll break that leaf in half. Dwyane: That leaf is probably a stick and a stick won’t break in half. Dillan: That leaf would probably deserve it. Going around and hitting peoples trucks isn’t good. Ashley: You’ll never catch that leaf.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 27, 2017
item.description: Dave: Bruce! Come here! What happened to your face? Let me see. Bruce: I don’t know. I think the beehives. Dave: The beehives? Bruce: The beehives the doctor gave us the yucky medicine for. Dave: Oh, you mean the hives. Bruce: Yeah, the beehives. Dave: No, it’s not the hives this time. It kind of looks like you hit something. Bruce: Yeah, I hit my nose on the steps. Dave: No, you did that last night.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 26, 2017
item.description: [This is funny because there’s a real possibility Dillan would have answered differently.] Lesa: Dillan, are you outside with your clothes on? Dillan: Yeah. Lesa: And your underwear too? Dillan: Yeah. Lesa: Okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 25, 2017
item.description: Ashley: I’m having trouble going to sleep. Dave: Think of something good you like. Ashley: Okay, I’ll think of bunnies jumping all over me. Ashley: Daddy, I just thought of something. Dave: You did? What? Ashley: It’s like a baby sheep, except it can stand on it’s back legs, and hop like a bunny, and has bunny ears. Dave: Sounds nice Ashley. I can understand why you’re having trouble sleeping.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 22, 2017
item.description: Bruce: I want a dog that talks. Dave: Dogs don’t talk. Wait, a real dog or a toy dog? Bruce: A real dog. Dave: Dogs don’t talk. Bruce: I want a robot dog that talks. Dave: What kind? Bruce: A blue one. Dave: You want a blue robot dog that talks Bruce: Yeah, a blue one. Dillan: Bruce, I wouldn’t want one of those. You can’t snuggle with a robot dog like you can snuggle with Switzee.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I was good. I was good all day. Dave: That’s awesome! Mommy will be so happy too! Bruce: I tried super hard to be super good so you’d be super happy. Dave: I am super happy! You did a super job! Mommy will be super happy too! Bruce: Daddy, don’t tell Mommy. I will tell Mommy I did super good when we get home.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 20, 2017
item.description: Dave: You kids be civilized. Ashley: That means don’t be bad, be good. Dwyane: I sometimes have trouble doing that. Lesa: I know. It’s hard!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 19, 2017
item.description: Bruce, worried about his hair after combing it himself yesterday morning: Can you roll up the window? My hair will get ruined.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 18, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Do you spell your name D-A-V-I-D? Dave: You know I do, why? Ashley: That car other there has a sticker with your name. That’s just creepy … and a little scary.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 15, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, after Lesa took away some old phones from Dillan and Ashley: Mommy, you are the key master. You take everyone’s phone.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 14, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, because you’re so strong, you might want to buy some apples and squeeze them to make us apple juice.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 13, 2017
item.description: Bruce, to Lesa: I’m going to stay up and go to bed with you because it’s not fair that you get to stay up and eat popcorn.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 12, 2017
item.description: Dave: I cut my hair on the deck Saturday morning and came in the house acting mad, and said: Alright! Who took my hair? I had it on and now it’s gone! Bruce: Where’d your hair go Daddy? Dave: I’m pretty sure some kid took it. Ashley: No, I saw you cut it. Dave: No. That’s not right. You didn’t see me cut it. Dillan and Ashley: We did! You were right over there and you cut it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 11, 2017
item.description: Bruce: There’s no one on the road except us. Dave: You’re right. Bruce: But we’re the only one. Dave: Yeah, I know. Do you have a point you’re trying to make? Bruce: I don’t have any points yet Daddy. I didn’t know we was playing a game. How many points do I get?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 8, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Chocolate ice cream is kind of like hot chocolate – except cold!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 7, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, you know that thing you cut grass with? Dave: You mean the lawnmower. Bruce: Yeah, the lawnmower. I watched how you put gas in it and I watched you cut grass with it and now I know how. So can I cut the grass?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 6, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, after hearing us tell Bruce he needed to behave at daycare, told Bruce: When you get old like me you will have to behave – or you will die.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 5, 2017
item.description: [After watching Boss Baby with the kids, the kids showed visible pride at being part of a family.] Dwyane, sticking his chest out: We used to be Moffett kids but now we’re Williams kids! Dillan, in reply, shouted: I don’t know no Moffett kids! Ashley: You guys must have 5 hearts to love all of us! Bruce: Can you come sit with me?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 1, 2017
item.description: Dave: Bruce, are you ready to go? Bruce: Yes. Dave: Then what is that laying on the chair? Bruce: Oh, I forgot my underwear.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 31, 2017
item.description: Dave, to Dwyane: What are you eating? Dwyane: Nothing. Dave: Did you sneak some candy? Dwyane: No. Dave: Then what are you chewing on? Dwyane: My toe nail. Dave: Okay. I didn’t really expect that answer. I guess that’s okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 30, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, would a school bus squash your truck? Dave: Yup, it would certainly make a mess. Dillan: Would it kill us? Dave: Maybe could. Dillan: That bus was on our side, that’s dangerous. Dave: Yup, but you notice I gave it all the room I could. I wouldn’t want to hit a school bus. Dillan: Cause it’d squash us? Ashley: Because of the children. Dave: Exactly Ashley. And I don’t want squashed.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 29, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, I love you to the moon and back 100 times! Dave: I love you too Ashley. I’m glad you like being my daughter. Ashley: Why would you say that? Dave: Well, you could say I’m not your real dad and you hate me. Sometimes adopted kids say stuff like that. Ashley: Never! You’re my only Dad! Daddy, do you know why I love you? Dave: No Ashley, why? Ashley: For 5 reasons: 1) because you love me, 2) because you adopted me, 3) because you’re nice to me, 4) because you’re the best Dad ever!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 28, 2017
item.description: Dave, to Ashley: Are you trying to be like a mom and tell people what to do? Ashley: No! Dave: So, you just like bossing people around then? Ashley: I do!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 25, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, we’re out of candy braclets. Can you buy some more? Dave: Sure. Dwyane: It doesn’t have to be right now. You can wait until tonight. Dave: Oh, okay, thanks.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 24, 2017
item.description: Dave: Bruce, can you pick up that mess please? Bruce: I didn’t make a mess. Dave: Yes you did, I see it right there. Bruce: No, that mess is from yesterday.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 23, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, why did you burn your leg on that motorcycle? Dave: It was an accident. Bruce: Why? Dave: Well, actually, I was teaching you kids what not to do. Bruce: Okay Daddy, I won’t do that.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 22, 2017
item.description: Ashley: You’re my Daddy. Dave: You’re my Ashley. Ashley: My Daddy. Dave: My Ashley. Ashley: Mine. Dave: No mine. Ashley: Mine. Dave: Mine. Ashley: Mine. Dave: Mine. Ashley: Mine. Dave: Okay, hold up! Let’s agree we’re each others? Ashley: Okay. Dave: Okay, my Ashley. Ashley: Daddy!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 21, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, eating his hamburger at dinner, looked at Lesa and said: We have the meat!

item.title: Bruce Quote of the Day – August 18, 2017 (Contributed by Forest Moser)
item.description: Bruce: Uh Alexa what is the weather like? Ms. Forest why isn’t she answering to me?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 18, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, when I’m on my tablet and Scooby-Doo comes on I always have to watch Scooby-Doo. Dave: Oh yeah, how come? Ashley: I learn stuff. Dave: What kind of stuff? Ashley: Well, not really. But I learn stuff from Jerry. Dave: What do you learn from Tom and Jerry? Ashley: I learn how cats don’t act. Real cat’s don’t do all that stuff but dogs do. Real cats just look at the mouse and walk away and let the dog get them.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 17, 2017
item.description: Dave: Ashley, do you have shorts on under that dress? Ashley: No. I don’t have gym today. Dave: I know, but you have recess, and even though you’re doing great at being a young lady you’re still learning, and I’d feel better if you had some shorts on. Maybe some pink shorts to match your dress? Ashley: How do you know that‽ Dave: Know what? Ashley: That I have pink shorts.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 16, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Ashley, how was your day at school? Ashley: It’s weird. All these people were here last year. It’s all the same people. It feels like I’m still in first grade. Lesa: You’re growing up with everybody you know. Isn’t that kind of cool? Ashley: No, not really.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 15, 2017
item.description: Bruce, on the morning after his new haircut: Look Mommy, I still have my hair cut! Dwyane: Me too! Bruce: I don’t think Ashley still has her’s though.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 14, 2017
item.description: Bruce, running into the dining room: Mommy, I was running so fast I pooped my pants! Lesa: Uuhh … quit running! Uuhh … quit … uuhh … running! … Uuhh! Dave: Bruce, walk, don’t run, out back and take off your pants so I can hose you down.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 11, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, I almost fell asleep just hugging you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 10, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, Alicia eats bunnies. Dave, teasing Ashley: I would too if I had any to eat. Ashley: Awww, but I love bunnies! Dave, still teasing Ashley: I do too. They taste good. Ashley: Don’t eat the bunnies! Dillan, teasing Ashley: I don’t know what bunnies taste like but I bet they’re yummy! Bruce: Daddy, what do bunnies taste like? Dave: Like chicken of course! Bruce, teasing Ashley: Yummy! Yummy! Yummy!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 9, 2017
item.description: Bruce, to Dwyane: I don’t need to cough anymore. I gave them all to you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 8, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, what are we having for supper? Lesa: Frozen pizzas. Dwyane: But I don’t want ice pizza!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 7, 2017
item.description: [Bruce was helping Lesa in the kitchen while she was cooking dinner. He helped with the eggs, then he wanted to help with something else. Bruce noticed that the plastic container drawer wasn’t closed. Lesa told him it wouldn’t close because the plastic containers needed to be organized. Bruce went ahead and organized it for Lesa! Wow! It closes now.] Then Lesa wanted to feed the chickens. She handed Bruce an ear of corn and asked him to shuck it (he’s shucked corn before).

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 4, 2017
item.description: Ashley: I need my beauty sleep. Bruce: I need my boy sleep. Ashley: You mean you need your mean sleep.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 3, 2017
item.description: Bruce, to Dave: You a teacher!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 2, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, I’m full of chocolate.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 1, 2017
item.description: Dillan, on the Ferris Wheel: This can’t be good. Can we go down now and make them stop? Ashley, on the Ferris Wheel: Daddy, I don’t want to sit by you. I want to go by myself! Dwyane, on the Ferris Wheel: I’m gonna die! I’m gonna die! I’m gonna die! I’m gonna die! Bruce, on the Ferris Wheel: This is so awesome! This is so awesome! This is so awesome!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 31, 2017
item.description: Dave: Get dressed. Bruce: Why? Dave: Because I have to go to work and you have to go to daycare. Bruce: I thought daycare was over? Ashley: Not until college! Dave: Yeah, what she said!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 28, 2017
item.description: Bruce: No! Lesa: Bruce, are you arguing with me? Bruce: I am Momma. Lesa: Well, I think you should stop, don’t you? Bruce: Okay Momma.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 27, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, how was your day? Lesa: It was good. Bruce: Did the house fall on you? Lesa: No. Bruce: Did the tree? Lesa: No!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 26, 2017
item.description: Ashley, shocked and surprised to see a horse running across a field: Horses can run‽ Dave: Of Course! God made them for running. They like to run. Ashley: I didn’t know they could run. I only ever seen them walking.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 25, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daxson cried when we took his blanket to make a fort. Dave: Then quit taking his blanket. Use someone else’s. Use someone’s blanket that wants to make a fort. Bruce: But I don’t like him anymore. Dave: You should be nice to everyone anyway. You might like him later. Besides, didn’t you go bowling with him for his birthday last year? Bruce: That was Jackson. He doesn’t have birthdays anymore.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 24, 2017
item.description: Bruce, to Lesa: I found a job. My job is being bad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce, at swim lessons: My eyes hurt when I open them underwater. Lesa: Maybe you shouldn’t open them? Bruce, walking away: I’ll tell my boss I’m not going to anymore.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 20, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, can we go to the county fair tonight? Dave: No, we have swim lessons. But Mommy and me are planning to take you kids to the fair in a week or two. Dwyane: No, I want to go to the COUNTY fair. Dave: Right, we’re going to go to the Monroe County Fair. Dwyane: NO, THE COUNTY FAIR. Dave: Right, the COUNTY FAIR. I got it now.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 19, 2017
item.description: Dillan, not wanting to share his LEGOs tried to justify not sharing by saying: Bruce and Dwyane can’t have LEGOs. They will choke on them. [He didn’t know Dwyane was about to get a 1000-piece LEGO box for his birthday later that evening.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 17, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Hey Daddy, I fell asleep during my nap. Dave: Duh! Isn’t that what naps are for? Ashley: No.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 14, 2017
item.description: [All the kids were singing in unison this Christmas song in July:] Dwyane: Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way. So much fun it is to ride in a one horse open sleigh. Bruce: Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way. So much fun to ride, eh! Ashley: Jingle bells, jingle bells, jingle all the way. Oh what fun it is to ride in a one horse open sleigh, eh!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 13, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, how do they make paint? Dave: I don’t know. I never wondered about that. Bruce: They take stuff and add glue. Dillan: That doesn’t make sense. Bruce: They take water and add glue and then it’s blue paint. Dillan: They use your face! And add glue. And then they have Bruce paint! Dave: Boys, quit being mean. Dillan: Can you ask your phone how do you make paint? Dave: Sure, I can do that.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 12, 2017
item.description: Bruce, not recognizing the road we were on, said: Daddy, I don’t think you know where you’re at. Dave: I do know where I’m at. Bruce: No, I think you’re lost.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 11, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, waking up from his nap: Daddy, I missed you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 10, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, to Bruce: You farted! Bruce: No I didn’t. It’s the cow poop. Dwyane: No, it’s not! There’s no cows around here!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 7, 2017
item.description: Bruce, at Pizza Hut, to our shock and dismay, said loudly: Oh my God! Look at that butt!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 6, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Rain, rain, go away. Come back another day. Bruce started a second round and we joined in: Rain, rain, go away. Come back another day. Bruce, incredulous and amazed, asked: How do you know that song‽

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 5, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy and Daddy, thanks for taking us to all the places you take us.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 30, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Can we watch TV? Dave: No. Bruce: Why not? Dave: We’re going to eat and then go somewhere. Bruce: Like Florida? Dave: No, not Florida. Sorry. Bruce: Ohhhhhh!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 29, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, with a big grin: Mommy, if Daddy dies before you do, I’m going to marry you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 28, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, I prayed to God this morning that when I die I’ll be able to go to your house in Heaven.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 27, 2017
item.description: Ashley, sitting at the kitchen table by herself eating ice cream: I have to quit talking. I’m not eating my ice cream. I’m still talking. I have to quit talking so I can eat my ice cream.

item.title: Kid “Living in the Country” Quote of the Day – June 26, 2017
item.description: After a trip to Goose Pond, Ashley said: Oh look, there’s a chigger [tick]. Ashley picked it off and said: Daddy needs pliers [tweezers] to get them off. I used my fingernails. After grinding it between her fingernails, Ashley said: Oh look, there’s a dead chigger now. Bruce started chanting: Dead chigger, dead, dead, dead, dead, dead, dead, dead, dead …

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 23, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, you’re beautiful. Lesa: Thank you! Dwyane: Mommy, am I handsome? Lesa: You are!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 22, 2017
item.description: Lesa put on her new pajamas and Ashley said: Mommy, those are pretty. You should wear them to church.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 21, 2017
item.description: Dillan, after riding his bike in the rain: Mommy, that was awesome! The road flooded and I rode my bike in it! I was pretending there was tornadoes!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 20, 2017
item.description: Dwyane during his evening prayer Sunday night: Thank you for letting Mommy in my heart. Thank you for letting Daddy in my heart. Thank you for letting Jesus and God in my heart. I love you God.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 19, 2017
item.description: [On Friday:] Ashley: Daddy, your hair is growing back. Dave: Maybe I should keep it shaved. Everybody said it made me look younger. Ashley: You still look old because you wear old people clothes. Dave: So what kind of clothes do you think I should wear then? Ashley: Those shorts are okay, but you need a lime green shirt. [On Saturday:] Dave: Ashley, I have those shorts on and a lime green shirt.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 16, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Drumsticks take a long time to eat if you don’t bite the ice cream.

item.title: Adult Quote of the Day – June 15, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Boy, you sure can tell DCS doesn’t visit anymore when you see the kids’ bathroom.
