item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 14, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mary had a little lamb – and she couldn’t keep it – so she got a cow and ate it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 13, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Mommy, I ate some watermelon seeds. Will a watermelon grow in my belly? Lesa: I’ve eaten hundreds of them and haven’t had one grow yet. Ashley: I’ve ate tons and tons of watermelon seeds and I haven’t grown a single watermelon in my stomach. If I did I would feel something strange in my belly and probably would be too full to eat.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 12, 2017
item.description: [Kid Quotes related to Fairfax Beach] Bruce, before we even got to the beach: This is the best day ever! Dillan while at the beach: Daddy, can you check your calendar for next Sunday? Dave: Why? Dillan: To see if we can come back. Dwyane at supper: This is the greatest day ever! Ashley’s corrected him saying: The greatest days ever is when we was born, and when we was adopted, and then today.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 9, 2017
item.description: Walking past the jewelery cabinet at Walmart, Ashley said: Daddy, is this where you got your wedding ring? Dave: No, Walmart wasn’t invented when Mommy and me got married. Ashley: Wow, that was a really long time ago. Dave: You don’t have to tell me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 8, 2017
item.description: [Bruce refused to go into the dentist’s examination room – not even with Dwyane or Lesa.] Lesa: How come you don’t want to go in there? Bruce: Because he will cut off my head!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 7, 2017
item.description: [A DVD was been stuck in my truck’s DVD player for about a year.] Ashley: The DVD came out. Dave: Cause you kept hitting it with your head and it finally popped out. Ashley: Yeah, I have a hard head! Dave: You sure do! Ashley: So can we watch movies again? If it gets stuck I’ll just hit it with my head some more.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 6, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, I’m really enjoying the ride this morning. I wish we could go on all the roads. Dave: So do I Dwyane, so do I.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 5, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Scooby-Dooby-Doo, we love you … Dwyane: No, it’s Scooby-Dooby-Doo, where are you, we love you … Dillan: No, it’s Scooby-Dooby-Doo, where are you, we’ve got a mystery to do now … Ashley: Daddy, can Scooby-Dooby-Doo really talk? Dave: No Ashley, Scooby-Dooby-Doo is a cartoon dog. Ashley: But could a real dog talk? Dave: They kind of talk, they bark and make noises and we sometimestime understand what they want. Ashley: It would be nice to know what they say to us.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 2, 2017
item.description: Lesa: How can you be hungry when you just ate lunch? Bruce: Because we’re the hungry people!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 1, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: These shoes are tight. Dave: Are they getting small? Dwyane: No, my feet are getting big. I like when they’re tight cause they don’t fall off. Dave: Ah, makes sense. Lesa: I just checked those shoes! They’re not too small, they fit perfect.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 31, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, sometimes when I pretend to sleep I fall asleep.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 19, 2017
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa: Do I look sharp? Lesa: Holy moly! You look sharp!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 18, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Yee-haw!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 17, 2017
item.description: Dillan looking for his homework after doing it: I’m getting like mommy! I put things down then don’t remember where I put it!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 16, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, to his tee-ball coach: I’m fast! Dillan’s slow.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 15, 2017
item.description: Golden Slumber Melody by the Beatles played on the radio and I turned it up. You know which part. Afterward I said: I grew up listening to that kind of music. Dillan: I liked it too Daddy. Dwyane: I was playing [air] guitar on my belly! Ashley: What was that music? Dave: It was a band called The Beatles. Dillan: I think I saw a picture of them once. Ashley, not to be outdone: I saw two beetles in my room one time!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 12, 2017
item.description: Bruce to Jenny at daycare: Why are your toe nails painted? Jenny: Because I’m a girl. Bruce: I used to be a girl at home – but don’t worry – I turned into a boy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 11, 2017
item.description: Ashley pretend calling Dillan on the phone: Dillan? Hello? Dillan? Dillan, in a deep hushed voice: You’re gonna die!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 10, 2017
item.description: Lesa to Dwyane: Good job using the wash rag to clean your face. Dwyane: Cause I’m a smart kid … and strong!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 9, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, it’s almost Mother’s Day. Dave: I know, and I haven’t gotten Mommy anything yet. Dwyane: We should get her flowers. Dave: Flowers are nice. Mommy likes flowers but flowers don’t last very long. That’s kind of what makes them special though. Bruce: Get her a ring! Dave: A ring? Bruce: What goes on her ears. Dave: You mean earrings. Bruce: Yeah, they’ll last until fireworks time! Dwyane: Yeah, I think Mommy needs rings.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 8, 2017
item.description: Ashley to Dave last night at dinner: Mommy made the ketchup on the meat loaf. Dave: I know, Mommy used to make real ketchup and it was yummy! Dillan: Can you make some more? Lesa: No, not for awhile. I don’t have time to any more. Dillan: Why not? Lesa: I traded my flower and vegetable gardens for a kid garden. Lesa: Now I plant seeds, feed, water, weed, and tend to children with love.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 5, 2017
item.description: Ashley: It rained, and I got soaked. Dave: How did that happen? Were you in the rain? Why didn’t you go in before you got soaked? Ashley: It was raining everywhere! It was like a rain blizzard!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 4, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Eewww! Dillan smells like a wet dog!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 3, 2017
item.description: While riding in the car, Lesa asked: Bruce, Why are your shoes off? Bruce replied: Dwyane took my shoes off. Dwyane: Did not! Bruce: Did! Dwyane: Did not! Lesa: Bruce, how did Dwyane do that when you’re sitting way over there? Bruce: He has rubber arms that stretch.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 2, 2017
item.description: Lesa to Dave: I can’t believe all the flooding! Dwyane, in a panic: Is God going to flood the Earth again‽ Lesa: No. Don’t worry, we’re way up on a hill and God promised us he wouldn’t do that again. Ashley to Dwyane: That’s why we have rainbows Dwyane.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 1, 2017
item.description: On the way to church, Lesa said: Dwyane, you look sharp! Ashley: I’m not sharp, I’m pretty. Lesa: Yes you are pretty and the boys look handsome. That’s what looking sharp means.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 28, 2017
item.description: Bruce was sitting in Lesa’s lap watching TV. He pointed at each breast and love handle while counting: One, two, three, four. Mommy, you have four boobies!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 27, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, Dillan called me a butt face. Dillan: No, I said you’re nice and I like you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 26, 2017
item.description: Bruce: I was on a plane! Lesa: You remember that? Awesome! Wasn’t that cool? Bruce: My ears were popping. Lesa: They were hard to pop. Dillan: Mine didn’t pop until a couple of days ago.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 25, 2017
item.description: Bruce, in the truck: Uh-oh! Somebody farted! [He paused for dramatic effect.] It was me!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 24, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: We saw a movie. Ashley: Oh, I didn’t get to see it! Dave: That’s because I took you to a square dance, remember? Dillan: Yeah, Mommy drove us and got there all on her own!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I had a dream about witchs and kids. Dave: Oh no! Was the witch trying to get the kids? Bruce: No, it was just a witch dream. Dave: Oh okay. Dwyane: Daddy, I had a dream about witches and kids too. The witches were trying to eat the kids! Dave: Oh my! Like Hansel and Gretel? Dillan: Hansel and Gretel got away. Dwyane: Would you kill a witch that tried to eat us?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 20, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, who didn’t have school yesterday, said: I accidentally brought my backpack. I’m a silly boy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 19, 2017
item.description: Dave: Dillan, what do you really think about us getting to adopt you? Dillan: I’m happy because I’ll finally have a family and not have to go to any more houses. Dave: You’ve been here a really long time. Dillan: I know. Dave: Long enough to know how I am. I’m old and not likely to change very much. Dillan: That’s okay. Dave: I’m not perfect and neither is Mommy. Things will never be perfect.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 18, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Did everyone brush their teeth? Dillan: Ashley didn’t, but I did 79 times! Can you tell?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 17, 2017
item.description: Dave: Ashley, I heard you pulled the tail off the Easter Bunny at daycare. Ashley: Daddy, I don’t think it was the real Easter Bunny. Dave: Why do you say that? Ashley: It had a zipper and when it walked you could see it. Dillan: And it looked like it had a black shirt underneath. Only Netta wears black shirts like that. Ashley: Jess does. Dillan: But Jess was taking the pictures.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 14, 2017
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, did you fire Daddy?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 13, 2017
item.description: Ashley, talking about the order of morning hugs and kisses: I know why Mommy kisses Daddy last. She saves the best for last!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 12, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Dillan, hurry up and finish your bath. Dillan: Mommy, do you know what I’m doing? Lesa: Playing in the bath? Dillan, excited: I’m bombing boats! Did you know there was a war with England? Lesa: Yes, I knew that. Dillan: You know that song? Lesa: Yeah. Dillan, getting very excited now: The guy that wrote that was really there! Can you imagine that?!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 11, 2017
item.description: Ashley: My underwear is too tight. Dave: Maybe your butt is too big? Ashley: No, I don’t think so. Dave: Well, if you’re certain it’s not a big butt problem and think it’s just an underwear problem then go put on a different pair and see if that helps. Ashley, a few minutes later: Thanks Daddy, that helped! Dave: You’re welcome Ashley. At least your butt wasn’t too big. Ashley: Yeah, then none of my underwear would fit!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 10, 2017
item.description: Dillan, talking about the REMC Annual Board Meeting: They talked a whole lot and kept saying the same thing over and over!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 7, 2017
item.description: Dillan: What is this? Dave: It’s barbecue beef. Lesa: Pork, not beef. Dave: You know what I meant. Bruce: Mint? I want a mint!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 6, 2017
item.description: Bruce, as we left Pizza Hut: We made a mess out of that table!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 5, 2017
item.description: Bruce, ordering from Pizza Hut: I want pancakes!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 4, 2017
item.description: Dave, to the kids: Remind me to get gas on our way home. Dwyane: Oh no! Are we going to get stuck on the road? No one will ever find us! Dave: No, we have plenty, I just don’t like to get to low. Dillan: How much do we have? Dave: Well, according to the computer we have 98 miles left. Dillan: Wow! This truck is awesome!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 3, 2017
item.description: Lesa: Bruce, you are causing too much trouble at daycare! Bruce: But Mommy, I can run faster than the teacher.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 31, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Where are we going today? Dave: To daycare, school, and work. Bruce: And Florida? Dave: I wish!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 30, 2017
item.description: Talking about her brothers, Ashley said: Daddy, they’re like monsters!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 29, 2017
item.description: While taking a shower the bathroom door opened and someone said: I love you Daddy. Not knowing for sure which kid said it, Dave asked: Who just said that? Bruce replied: Brucie Williams! Dave: Well, hi Bruce! I love you too!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 28, 2017
item.description: Ashley, who often gets “sick” when it’s bedtime: Daddy, when I’m with you I don’t feel sick but when you leave I feel sick. Dave: Is that so? That’s kind of amazing. And only at bedtime! Ashley: Yeah, it’s like your love is medicine soaking into me. Dave: Better not let Lesa hear that or she’ll be the one getting sick! She’ll want to baarrrffff!!!!! [Then we had a good laugh about that.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 27, 2017
item.description: Lesa stayed home from church and before I drove even one mile Dwyane said: This is a long road far from our house. I sure do miss Mommy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 24, 2017
item.description: Bruce: I wear underwear. I’m a big kid.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 23, 2017
item.description: Dillan and Dwyane trying to get Ashley in trouble: Daddy! Ashley knocked over the badminton net. Dave: What do you want me to do? Beat her for knocking down something you guys’ have knocked down a hundred times before? Dillan and Dwyane excited by my answer: Yeah!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 22, 2017
item.description: Ashley, after watching me take out a denture while driving: Daddy, you could cause a wreck. Dave: What do you mean? Ashley: Someone might see your teeth and think it’s gross and wreck.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce, when asked to hurry up: I’m slower now cause I’m growing up.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 20, 2017
item.description: Ashley’s answer to a classroom question: Instead of gold, I would like a pot of … puppies and kittens and chocolate and rainbows.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 17, 2017
item.description: Ashley, getting tucked into bed: Daddy, ever since I’ve known you there hasn’t been one day when I haven’t been with you. Dave: Is that good or bad? Ashley: That’s a good thing cause I love you so much – to the moon and back 300 times!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 16, 2017
item.description: Bruce: I don’t see nobody in that truck, I just see a head.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 14, 2017
item.description: Bruce, singing (shouting) and dancing (stomping his feet): We will, we will, ROCK YOU!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 13, 2017
item.description: [Sunday morning when I woke up.] Ashley: Daddy, I love you! Dwyane: Did you have a good sleep Daddy? Bruce running to give me a hug: I like and love you. Dillan: Daddy, you know what Ashley did?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 10, 2017
item.description: [While driving to daycare – in the dark.] Ashley: Daddy, is the boogeyman real? Dave: Yes, but not like on TV. You might call people that sneak around at night stealing stuff and doing other bad things a boogieman. Dillan: Have we ever seen a boogeyman? Dave: Maybe, but if we did we probably didn’t know it. They’re sneaky like that! Dillan: Oh! Has a boogeyman ever been at our house?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 9, 2017
item.description: Ashley, doing an impression of Lesa doing an impression of Zsa Zsa Gabor: I love you I love you I love you dahling! Mommy says that all the time!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 8, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, when asked how his day was: I watched 100 movies! Bruce, not to be outdone: Me too! Dillan: I know that’s a lie. I just heard a fib! Ashley: They’re little Dillan, they’re just using their imagination.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 7, 2017
item.description: Bruce, watching Monster Jam, when a commercial came on: Daddy, where’d it go‽ Dave: Don’t you worry, it’ll be back on. Bruce: But I want to worry!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 6, 2017
Kid Quote of the Day – March 3, 2017
item.description: Ashley to Dave: Can you make me a sack lunch today? I didn’t want to bother Mommy because she was working and she always works and I didn’t want to make more work for her so I didn’t ask her.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 2, 2017
item.description: Bruce: I like and love you.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 1, 2017
item.description: Dave: We have to put Curio to sleep.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 28, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, mimicking Spirit 95’s morning show, woke up and said: Good morning, it’s high octane.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 27, 2017
item.description: Ashley, asking about our PAVA PO Box: Was anything in it?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 24, 2017
item.description: Dave: Are you eating your breakfast, or talking?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 23, 2017
item.description: Ashley, super excited: Mommy! Guess what!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 22, 2017
item.description: Ashley: When I pass my bubby in the hallway [at school] I hug him.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 21, 2017
item.description: Bruce, during bath time, in a panic yells: Daddy, Dwyane has a big scratch on his bottom!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 20, 2017
item.description: Dillan, after the Pinewood Derby races: Thanks for signing me up for Scouts. I’ve never had fun like this before.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 17, 2017
item.description: Bruce, sitting across from Ashley during breakfast: Ashley, quit looking at me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 16, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, at dinner: Some kid hit me with a toy. He threw 100 toys at me!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 15, 2017
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I made a heart for you and Mommy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 14, 2017
item.description: Ashley, woke up, went potty, and peeked into the living room: Hi Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 13, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Dwyane loves me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 10, 2017
item.description: Dillan, doing Valentine cards, told Ashley: You wouldn’t believe how crazy over chocolate Mrs. Boshear’s is!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 9, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, to Lesa: Mommy, I’ve been having bad dreams.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 8, 2017
item.description: Bruce, wanting me to go to YouTube: I WANT MONSTER TRUCKS!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 7, 2017
item.description: Dillan, hinting at the absence of Ashley: It sure is quiet in here!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 6, 2017
item.description: Bruce, shortly after getting out of timeout: Daddy, I like and love you now.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 2, 2017
item.description: Ashley, after vomiting in my truck on the way home last night: That looks like …

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 31, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, to Lesa: I want a little brother.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 27, 2017
item.description: [Dwyane can’t wait to be in kindergarten. He wants to be like the older kids.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 26, 2017
item.description: Dillan, laying on the couch under a blanket, with Switzee’s head in his lap: Daddy, I know why you like this.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 25, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, dancing to a song on Spirit 95: Mommy, do I got the moves?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 24, 2017
item.description: Dave, getting the kids ready this morning: Okay kids, if you haven’t noticed, I overslept this morning. Now what I need you to do is to help me out by not messing around or fighting with each other.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 23, 2017
item.description: Dillan: Whew! What’s that smell?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 20, 2017
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, what if the adoption was yesterday and we missed it? Dave: Don’t worry. They won’t have the adoption without us. We won’t miss it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 19, 2017
item.description: Ashley: It’s not banana pudding, it’s banana pudding great!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 18, 2017
item.description: [There’s been a lot of talk about adoption since we’re really close.] Dwyane, to Lesa: When you adopt us we’ll shout from the roof top! Lesa: Yes we will! Ashley, to Dave: And we’ll have a big party! Dave: Yes we will!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 17, 2017
item.description: Dillan, at breakfast this morning: Trenton at school says Hilary [Clinton] is killing all the Christians. Dave: Has she killed any yet? Dillan: Yeah, bunches! Dave: I don’t think so. I would of heard about it. I think Trenton is just making it up to make Hilary look bad and Trump look good. Think about it. We’re Christians. Is she going to kill us? Dillan: You won’t let her, will you?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 16, 2017
item.description: The table next to us had a child that said Mommy, and Bruce said to Lesa: Why they calling you Mommy?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 13, 2017
item.description: Dillan, to Dwyane: Don’t be afraid of anything when Daddy drives. Be afraid when Mommy drives.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 11, 2017
item.description: Ashley, to Lesa: What are those? Dave: They’re Mommy’s “Sick and Tired of Kids” pills. Ashley: I don’t think they make pills for that. Dave: Well, they should. Lesa: They’re my new vitamins Ashley.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 10, 2017
item.description: Ashley to Dave: Those three boys of yours are crazy.  P r e t t y  c r a z y.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 9, 2017
item.description: Dwyane, watching the Polynesian dancers: I’m going to marry one of those!

item.title: Adult Quote of the Day – December 30, 2016
item.description: Lesa: Dwyane! Get your nose out of the dog’s butt! That’s yucky nasty!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 29, 2016
item.description: Dillan, to Dave: I was smart enough not to get in the mud. Ashley, to Dillan: I doubt that. I’m guessing you just didn’t want to get in trouble. Dave, to Dillan: You were smart enough not to get into trouble too. Good job!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 28, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, I know why God didn’t give you and Daddy babies of your own. Lesa: Why? Ashley: He was saving you for us!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 27, 2016
item.description: Dave: So Ashley, did you have a good Christmas? Dillan: I did! Ashley: No. I had a great Christmas!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 22, 2016
item.description: Dave: Ashley, you look tired. Ashley: Am not too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 21, 2016
item.description: Bruce, playing: Mommy, monsters are eating my family! Lesa, playing along: Are you going to save them? Bruce: No! You save them!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 20, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, when will I be ten? Dave: In four years. Ashley: Can’t I get there earlier?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 19, 2016
item.description: Ashley, to the younger boys: Don’t say that! [poopie] Daddy gets to say all the bad words.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 16, 2016
item.description: Dave, surprised: Ashley, are you being nice to Bruce? Ashley: Yeah, sometimes I kiss him even when he’s mean.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 15, 2016
item.description: Dave to Bruce: Your fingernails are dirty. Bruce: Of course they are.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 14, 2016
item.description: Ashley, showing Dave her dolls: This is my son. This one is my daughter. This one is my other son Evan, he is 5 years old, I adopted him, he is a mechanic already, he learned by watching Daddy. And this one is my other daughter, her name is Ping, she is only 1 year old, I adopted her yesterday. They only get to watch TV for 1 hour every day.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 13, 2016
item.description: Bruce to Lesa during supper: What is that? Lesa: Fish oil pill. [Twenty minutes later.] Lesa: What does everyone want for dessert? Bruce: Fish oil.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 12, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I know how to spell family! F-A-M-I-L-Y. Family. The I-L-Y part means I love you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 9, 2016
item.description: Ashley, bragging about how smart she is: I’m the one with half a brain.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 8, 2016
item.description: Dillan, observing some of the kids running around at church, said: Those kids aren’t housebroken yet.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 7, 2016
item.description: Ashley to Dave: Everything smells like you. Nothing smells like me. Dave: Is that a good thing or a bad thing? Ashley: You smell good. Dave: Thanks Ashley – I think. Ashley: I wished I could smell. [she pauses] Daddy? How do you smell? Dave: Well, didn’t you just say I smelled good? Ashley: Daddy! Dave: With my nose? Ashley: Daddy! You know what I mean! How do you smell good?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 6, 2016
item.description: Ashley, trying to take all the credit: I’m the one mostly with the ideas.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 5, 2016
item.description: Ashley, during supper: When I grow up I will get a boyfriend, and we will get married, and I’ll will have babies, one boy and one girl, and I will buy a house, and I will drive over to get Dave and Lesa to live in my house, and I will take care of them and cook every night, and my house will have three bedrooms – one for the kids to share, and one for Dave and Lesa to share, and one for me and my husband to share – and Dave and Lesa can have the love seat, and me and my husband will have the couch, and Dave and Lesa can share the love seat with the kids if they want.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 2, 2016
item.description: Bruce at supper started shouting: I’m on Olde Farm Road! Olde Farm Road! Dave: Bruce, why are you shouting that? Ashley: We was waiting for you, and Mommy called you, and you kept saying “Where you at? I can’t hear you.” and Mommy kept saying “I’m on Olde Farm Road.” and she was yelling it so you could hear, but you didn’t hear. Bruce: Olde Farm Road! Olde Farm Road! Dave: Okay, okay, I get it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – December 1, 2016
item.description: Dwyane to Ashley: You pretty like a mom.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 30, 2016
item.description: Ashley, trying on new clothes: This fits … gorgeous!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 29, 2016
item.description: Ashley singing: Old MacDonald had a farm. E-I-E-I-O. And on his farm he had a goat. E-I-E-I-O. With a meh meh here and a meh meh there, here a meh, there a meh, everywhere a meh meh. Old MacDonald had a farm. E-I-E-I-O. Dillan: That sounded like a dead goat! Ashley: Daddy, did that sound like a dead goat? Dave: No Ashley, it sounded okay. Dillan: It sounded like a dead goat!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 28, 2016
item.description: Dave to Ashley: No one can know everything – except God. Lesa, sarcastically: And Daddy. Daddy knows everything. Dave, sarcastically back: Yeah, I do know everything – except the Second Coming. Ashley: That’s next week.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 25, 2016
item.description: Dwyane dropped his deviled egg and said: Mommy, can I have another rotten egg? I dropped mine.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 24, 2016
item.description: Ashley to Dave: I like you better than hot dogs, no, better than pancakes!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 23, 2016
item.description: While Lesa was making bread pudding Dillan said: That smells so yummy my knees are getting weak! [Then he pretended to faint.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 22, 2016
item.description: Dave to Ashley: You look pretty in that dress. Ashley: I know. I’m always pretty. The prettiest one!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 21, 2016
item.description: Lesa, after Ashley spilled her water during supper: Oh, I’m melting! I’m melting! Dave being silly started talking like a Munchkin: Mommy’s the wicked witch! Follow the … Dillan, interrupting: … red brick road! Follow the red brick road! Ashley: That’s from the Wizard! Bruce: They died on that train. Ashley: That’s right! That’s when Marcy and Eleanor took us to that hotel! Lesa: I’m surprised you remember that Bruce! Ashley: Can we go back‽ Dave: Probably not.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 18, 2016
item.description: Bruce and Dwyane were playing when Lesa overheard Bruce say: Like I always say, Daddy will fix it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 17, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, it’s my turn to help. Dave: What? Dwyane: I can help carry? [He was talking about helping with dinner. Dillan helps set the table and serve on Monday, Ashley on Tuesday, Dwyane on Wednesday, Bruce on Thursday, Dave and Lesa on Friday and weekends.] Dave: We’re going to church for dinner tonight. You can carry your own plate. That way you help Mommy by not making her carry your plate.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 16, 2016
item.description: Ashley, at the dentist, pointed and loudly proclaimed: That’s an OLD person.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 15, 2016
item.description: Ashley: If I was … Ashley Apple Seed, instead of apples, I would plant pechis all over the world! The world would be very pechey and yume. You could call me Ashley Pech Seed!!!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 14, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Can I wake up the kids? Lesa: Not right now. Dillan: I know what “not right now” means – it means no.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 11, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, my belly has a headache.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 10, 2016
item.description: Dillan to Bruce: How come you have my cars? Bruce: Because your cars were on the floor. Dillan: You’re a great taker. Bruce: Boo hoo.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 9, 2016
item.description: Ashley to Dave: The more kisses and hugs you give me the more alive I get.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 8, 2016
item.description: Dave: Bruce, are you poopy? Bruce, calm as can be: No, Dillan farted. Dillan: I didn’t! Bruce: You did! [It was Bruce, he was poopy.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 7, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Daddy? What are you doing? Dave: I’m driving. What are you doing? Bruce: I’m lemonading [drinking lemonade].

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 4, 2016
item.description: Dillan: How do all those little people get in the radio?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 3, 2016
item.description: Ashley, watching Snow White run scared through the woods: She’s imaginating!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 2, 2016
item.description: Ashley, commenting about Lagoona Blue, a ghoul on the Welcome to Monster High movie: Wow, she’s stylish!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – November 1, 2016
item.description: [Kids had me turn off Hocus Pocus because it scared them. A short while later…] Dillan: Daddy, I think I’m ready for Hocus Pocus now. Ashley: Dillan! Are you serious‽ That head falling off and rolling away was way to scary for your little sister!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 31, 2016
item.description: Bruce: I’m Superman! Lesa: You’re Super Pooper!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 28, 2016
item.description: All the kids as we went out to eat: Look out Steak ‘n’ Shake! Here we come!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 27, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy? Where we going? Dave: Dillan and me are going to the Fireman Appreciation Dinner and Ashley is going to her Scout Halloween party and you boys are going to play on the playground with Mommy and then we’ll have pizza when we get home. Dwyane: The park by school? Dave: No, the park by Needmore School. Ashley: I know that park! There is a little kid park and a big kid park.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 26, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, talking about Halloween decorations: I’m not scared. There’s no such thing as ghosts and witches, only monsters.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 25, 2016
item.description: Bruce, telling everyone what he’ll do if he sees a monster: I’ll open his mouth and take out his teeth – just like Daddy’s.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 24, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, eating a bagel with cream cheese: Look Mommy, I made hand prints for you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 14, 2016
item.description: Ashley to Dwyane: You messed up my beautiful hair! Dwyane: You messed up my beautiful hair! Ashley: You hair isn’t beautiful! It’s like a blob on top of your head!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 13, 2016
item.description: Ashley drew a computer screen on cardboard complete with Google search for elephant. She said: Why, why, why? Why do I let the kids play on my computer? They always mess it up!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 12, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, you a good fixer. Dwyane: Daddy can fix everything!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 11, 2016
item.description: Ashley drew a computer screen on cardboard (complete with Google search). She said: Why, why, why? Why do I let the kids play on my computer? They always mess it up!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 10, 2016
item.description: When a Conservation Officer came to our house asking if we knew where a different address was, Dwyane patted the house, and told him: This is my house. I live here. This is my house! I live here!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 7, 2016
item.description: Ashley, reading a book to me: That’s not bad for a toothy girl! [She meant toothless girl.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 6, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dwyane is annoying me … Dave: Bruce, enough, now you’re the one annoying everyone.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 5, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, Dillan is bothering me. Dave: Dillan is just being Dillan. Ashley: Well, Bruce is being a Dillan, Dwyane is being a Dillan, and Dillan is a Dillan! Dave: And now Ashley is being a Dillan too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 4, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Let’s have a dance party! Dave: You need to hang out with boys more at daycare. Dwyane: Why? Dave: You don’t hear boys say that very often is all. Dwyane: Let’s have a boy’s dance party!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 3, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, help me clean my room. Dave: No, you clean it. Ashley: But I have small hands! It will take all night!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 30, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, Bruce said a bad word. Dave: He did? Bruce: Don’t worry about me Daddy, I’m okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 29, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Everyone that likes Ashley raise their hand. Ashley: That’s Dave and Lesa and Bruce that like Ashley and not Dillan and Dwyane. Dillan: I like you too when you’re not so annoying. Dwyane: Me too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 28, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: When I grow up I want to ride in a firetruck. Dave: A firetruck? Dwyane: I want to be a fireman! Dillan: I guess I’ll take fireman off my list. Dwyane: I guess I’ll add fireman to my list. Bruce: I want to be a fireman too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 27, 2016
item.description: Crossing Hwy 37 at Washboard Road, Dwyane said: Good job Daddy. You made it. Dillan: Daddy always makes it. Dwyane: You get lots of points Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 23, 2016
item.description: Ashley to Dave: Take off that green shirt and put on the gray one. Dave: Why? Ashley: The gray shirt matches your hair and makes you handsome.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 22, 2016
item.description: Bruce to Dave: Go by the burned house (on Cobb Lane). Dwyane to Dave: Don’t go! Mommy will freak out!. Bruce to Dave: I won’t let Mommy freak out.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 21, 2016
item.description: Dillan, drinking chocolate milk: They put something yummy in here!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 20, 2016
item.description: Driving home from church in my truck, after being told not to bother Dillan and to keep her hands to herself, I’m watching Ashley in the mirror holding her hand just inches from Dillan’s nose, and she says to me: I’m not touching him.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 19, 2016
item.description: Ashley to Dave: I promise 10 pinkie promises!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 16, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Scuz me! Dwyane: No! Scuz me! Bruce: No, scuz me! Dwyane: No! Scuz me! Bruce: No, scuz me! Dwyane: No! Scuz me!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 15, 2016
item.description: Ashley: You’re a pretty Mommy and you’re a pretty Daddy and I love you both so much!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 14, 2016
item.description: Ashley: It’s not like I’m a kid anymore!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 13, 2016
item.description: Bruce, singing to the radio: Just breathe.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 12, 2016
item.description: Bruce, walking into his bedroom: OH! MY! GOSH! I didn’t do THAT!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 9, 2016
item.description: Ashley, talking about Bruce: I’m in 1st grade. He’s still learning not to pinch and hit people.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 8, 2016
item.description: As we were driving across Cobb Lane ridge, the sun was breaking across the top of the fog below, and Bruce said: The sky is so pretty.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 7, 2016
item.description: Dave to Dillan on Monday night: Dillan, go brush your teeth. Dillan: Did Ashley go yet? Dave: No. Dillan: I always go first! Dave to Dillan on Tuesday night: Dillan, go brush your teeth. Dillan: Did Ashley go yet? Dave: Yes. Dillan: I always go last!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 6, 2016
item.description: Dave: Sometimes you guys don’t listen. Dwyane: I listen. Bruce: Not me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 2, 2016
item.description: What Ashley wrote on her assignment to write about a fun day: The Greatest Day. When Dave and Lesa got us and I have people in my family and I have my best mom and dad in the world. I love my mom and dad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 1, 2016
item.description: Dillan, talking to Ashley: You tell jokes back to back that you think is funny. It’s not.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 31, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Worms have butts. It’s the fat part.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 30, 2016
item.description: Dillan, after overhearing me tell a friend the adoption would be a few more weeks: Daddy, the adoption will be in two weeks? Dave: Yeah Dillan, it’ll be a couple of weeks, or 3, or 4, or more – however long it takes. Ashley: That’s awesome news! You guys have been waiting a long time to get to adopt us!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 29, 2016
item.description: Bruce: I’m so tired. Yawn. yawn. Yawn. [The words not the sound.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 26, 2016
item.description: Dwyane to Lesa: I like you more than Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 25, 2016
item.description: Dave: Dwyane! Did you hit Dillan? Dwyane: No. Dave: So, is Dillan lying? Dwyane: No. I kicked him.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 24, 2016
item.description: Ashley, eating a Fudgsicle: Hey, this tastes a lot like ice cream!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 23, 2016
item.description: Ashley, hobbling up to me at daycare: Daddy! Daddy! I fell! It was bleeding and they put a Band-Aid on and it was bleeding so much they put another one on! Dave, looking and seeing a scraped knee: Wow! You’re lucky there’s even any blood left! Ashley: Yeah! I am lucky!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 22, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, I’m so tired. Yawn. Yawn. Yawn. [The words, not the sounds.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 19, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: I got my wish. The electricity is back on.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 18, 2016
item.description: Ashley, running into daycare, yells to Pink Room: Mommy said we don’t have any electricity because Daddy didn’t pay the bill! Bruce: Yeah, we was camping. Dave: Mommy must be trying to get rid of her kids and husband in one fell swoop.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 17, 2016
item.description: Lesa: So Dwyane, why were you lying to me? Dwyane: I wasn’t actually lying, I just wasn’t telling the whole truth.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 16, 2016
item.description: As I passed a slower vehicle, Dwyane said: We have a lot of juice!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 15, 2016
item.description: Ashley, after having her tooth pulled: I was brave. I didn’t even cry one tear’s worth.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 12, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, we never have leftover pizza cause we eat it all!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 11, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Peanut butter makes my throat kind of peanut buttery.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 10, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, watching TV: I want that. Can you get me that? Lesa: I want a million dollars. Dwyane: Okay, I’ll get my piggy bank.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 9, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, when I grow up I still won’t like Brussel sprouts so you don’t have to fix me any.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 8, 2016
item.description: Dave: Some boys have long hair. I used to have long hair that I kept in a pony tail. Ashley: You’re freaking me out Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 5, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Hey Mommy, I think you make the best food in the world, even peas and stuff I don’t like.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 4, 2016
item.description: Ashley, at the fair, eating an ice cream cone: Where’s my napkin? Oh, it’s in my hand.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 3, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Ashley was the last to hatch. Lesa: No. Dillan: We don’t hatch. We’re born with skin. Ashley: Yeah, but really small skin.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 2, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I like the pretty sunrise. Dave: It is pretty. I like it too. Ashley: But not as pretty as me and Mommy, right? Dave: Right!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 1, 2016
item.description: Dave, during a conversation with the kids about material things on the way to day care: Almost everything costs money. And if it was a gift it probably cost someone else money. Ashley: Trees don’t cost money. Grass doesn’t cost money. Lot’s of stuff doesn’t cost money. Dave: Yeah, but when’s the last time you saw toys and clothes growing on trees? Dillan: Never! Ashley: Can we get some of those kinds of trees?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 29, 2016
item.description: When I got home late from work, Ashley ran to me and said: Come here so I can give you my “Best Daddy” kiss!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 28, 2016
item.description: Ashley at dinner: I know why they call it spaghetti. Dave and Lesa: Why? Ashley: Because you spa-slurp it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 27, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Hey Daddy. Hey Daddy! HEY DADDY! Dave: Hey what? Bruce: I’m not talking. I’m being quiet.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 26, 2016
item.description: Ashley started laughing uncontrollably after telling Dave: Come here my chunky little monkey!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 25, 2016
item.description: While Lesa was tucking Ashley into bed Ashley said: I smell a skunk in my room. Lesa: I don’t smell a skunk. Ashley: Yeah, it’s gone away now. Ashley put her hands behind her head and propped herself up: There it is again! Lesa, laughing: I think your underarms stink. Ashley: Huh?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 22, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, do you have to kiss to get married? Dave: Most people do. Ashley: Do you have to dance? Dave: You don’t have to but you’ll probably want to. Ashley: Then I’m not going to get married. Dave: What about the kids you want to have? How are you going to have kids without a husband? Ashley: I will have kids like my other mom. She wasn’t married, right? Dave: No, you need to be married.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 21, 2016
item.description: Dave: Ashley, pick up the mess in your room. Ashley: But Bruce made that mess. Dave: But it’s in your room though. Why should we pick up after you, or wash your dirty clothes, or clean your dirty supper dishes? We didn’t make those messes. Ashley: Because you love us? Dave: Isn’t that the same reason you should pick up the mess in your room? Ashley: Okay Daddy. I’ll pick it up.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 20, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, come look! Lesa: What? Dwyane: Look at all the flies in the window! [Lesa gets a fly swatter and starts swatting flies.] Dwyane: Wow Mommy, you’re a good fly killer!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 19, 2016
item.description: Bruce: I want a Jolly Rancher. Dwyane: Are we going to Jolly Rancher’s?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 18, 2016
item.description: Ashley: You are my Daddy, you will always be my Daddy, even if you’re dead. Dave: Thank you Ashley, I love you too. Ashley: Every day I will get off work and will get my kids and we will visit were you’re at and put flowers there. I know the perfect place where to put you. Dave: Oh ya!?! Where will I be? Ashley: We will have to drive there. We drive past every day.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 15, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: I’m a big boy. I wear big boy panties.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 14, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Look Daddy, bacon!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 13, 2016
item.description: Dave: It’s getting ready to rain. My hands hurt. Bruce: Dinosaur hands don’t hurt! Dave: Huh?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 12, 2016
item.description: Lesa: Dillan, get a tissue. Don’t pick your nose and eat it.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 11, 2016
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, will I always be older than Ashley?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 8, 2016
item.description: Lesa, after Dillan helped set the table: Thank you. You were very helpful. Dillan: Like always.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 7, 2016
item.description: Walking in on Bruce, Dwyane, and Dillan talking when they should have been sleeping, Bruce shouted: It was Dillan! It was Dillan!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 6, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, you can use some of my shampoo so your hair doesn’t smell bad any more.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 5, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I’m so upset Dillan got a tablet!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 1, 2016
item.description: Ashley at VBS closing: Can I have some pizza? Dave: Sure. Ashley: Can I have a cookie? Dave: Okay. Ashley: I’m thirsty, can I get something to drink? Dave: Yes. Ashley: Can I have some more pizza? Dave: No. Ashley: But I’m hungry! Dave: You ate supper, ate pizza, ate two cookies, had a Capri Sun, and drank a whole cup of lemonaide. There’s no way you’re hungry. Ashley: I’m going to starve to death!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 30, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Peanut butter lips, marshmallow toes, hands glued to your side, follow your nose.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 29, 2016
item.description: Dave: I sure hope they catch the person who’s been setting all this hay on fire. Dillan: Yeah, they should have a policeman catch him! Ashley: I wish you guys wouldn’t keep talking about it! Dave: Well it’s kind of hard to not talk about it when every time you drive by you can smell the burnt hay. Bruce: Yeah, it makes me want a hotdog!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 28, 2016
item.description: At Dillan’s baseball game, surrounded by people, Bruce said: Daddy, take out your teeth! Which prompted Dwyane and Ashley to say: Take out your teeth! We wanna see! Take out your teeth!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 27, 2016
item.description: As we were going down the highway, Dwyane said: Mommy, Bruce threw his new shoes out the window.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 24, 2016
item.description: Bruce, sitting with Dave, chatting about various things, said: Lesa makes a lot of flowers.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 23, 2016
item.description: Dillan, going into his bedroom: I just want some peace and quiet! [A chorous of noise just erupted from the other kids who started to tease him by yelling and screaming!] Dave to Dillan: Good luck with that! We’ve been trying to get some peace and quiet for three years now!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 22, 2016
item.description: Dillan, at dinner: I ate my whole plate without drinking. Is that amazing? Ashley: No, not really. Lesa: Yes Dillan, that’s amazing.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 21, 2016
item.description: [Overheard while the kids were playing Mom and Dad.] Ashley, pretending to be Lesa: You can’t die. You can’t ever die ’cause you have to take care of the kids. Dillan, pretending to be Dave: I’m a dad and a father. Dwyane: I want to be the baby.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 20, 2016
item.description: Bruce helped me get trash together and load the trailer, then said: I want to go to trash with you Daddy. Dave: Sure! You can go with me Bruce. It’ll just be you and me. The other kids watched TV instead of helping, and then said: We want to come with you too Daddy! Dave: No, I’m already done and ready to go and you didn’t help. Ashley whined: But I want to go!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 17, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Where are you going Mommy? Lesa: Crazy. Bruce: Can I go with you?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 16, 2016
item.description: Bruce: What is this? Lesa: Cantaloupe. Bruce: Can-a-op-e? Can-a you. Ha, ha. No! Can-a Daddy! Ha, ha, ha.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 15, 2016
item.description: After bedtime, when the kids were supposed to be sleeping, Dwyane was overheard saying: Bruce! Stop playing! Daddy’s coming!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 14, 2016
item.description: Bruce: I stepped on a bug. A big bug! Dwyane: Me too! I stepped on a bug! Dave, to Dwyane: Was it a big bug too? Dwyane: The biggest!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 13, 2016
item.description: Bruce, mimicking Dillan: Oh my word!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 10, 2016
item.description: Dillan, to Lesa at dinner: Batman is named Bruce Wayne. Bruce: BATMAN! Dwyane: And Robin Egg! Ashley: It’s just Robin, not Robin Egg. Dwyane: Nuh-uh. It’s Robin Egg! Ashley: Daddy, is Robin named Robin Egg? Dave: It’s just Robin, not Robin Egg. Dwyane: No. It’s Robin Egg!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 9, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Daddy, what are these? Dave: Jolly Ranchers. Do you like them? Bruce: Yeah. Dwyane: They are yummy! Bruce: Where do you get these? Dave: At Dollar General. Bruce: I want some every day. Dwyane: Me too! Ashley: Daddy, I just keep them in my mouth and it’s like making juice!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 8, 2016
item.description: I was tucking Ashley into bed when she said: Will you see the judge tomorrow? Dave, knowing Ashley thinks I have casual conversations with her, said: Yes I will see her and if I get the chance, I will ask her to please, please, please let us keep the Moffett kids. Ashley: Daddy, can you write that down so you won’t forget to ask her that? Dave: Ashley, I could never forget how much I love you guys.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 7, 2016
item.description: While driving home the kids started fighting with each other. Dave: Keep your hands to yourselves! A few minutes later, Ashley yells: Daddy, Dillan is choking himself! Dave: Thanks, okay. Dillan, why are you choking yourself? Dillan: I don’t know, just because. Dave: Okay, go ahead then. Ashley, if he wants to choke himself, I guess just let him. Ashley: Okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 6, 2016
item.description: Ashley, playing in the pool over the weekend: THIS IS THE BEST DAY EVER!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 3, 2016
item.description: Coming home from playing Glow-in-the-Dark Golf, Dillan and I stopped for Frosties. As I was driving home, Dillan said: You’re the best Dad. Dave: Why, because I took you to golf and got you a Frosty? Dillan: Yeah, and because you play with me and spend time with me and take care of me. Dave: Wow Dillan, thanks!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 2, 2016
item.description: Driving to daycare with just Dwyane and Bruce, Bruce said: Wow Daddy, it’s quiet. Dwyane: Yeah, really quiet!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – June 1, 2016
item.description: Bruce: There’s witches! Dave: Where? Bruce: In the truck! Dave: I don’t see any witches in the truck. Dwyane: They’re in the back. Lots of them! Dave: I don’t see any witches. Why aren’t they getting you? Are you boy witches? Dwyane, sounding incredulous: We’re just kids Daddy. I’m a kid, Bruce is a kid, and you’re a Daddy! Dave: Okay, I still don’t see any witches though. Bruce: If witches try to get us you will get them, right Daddy?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 31, 2016
item.description: Dwyane during his bath: I’m going to miss school.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 30, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, watching Ashley’s graduation on video: Mommy, I needed to be there! You should have got me out of class to watch!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 27, 2016
item.description: Dillan getting bored at Ashley’s graduation ceremony: Mommy, I think I better go back to class now because I’m missing a lot of work!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 26, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: At night the boogers escape. Lesa: What do they do when they escape? Dwyane: I don’t know. Dillan: They’ll get and kill you! Ashley: No, they’ll dry up.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 25, 2016
item.description: Dillan, who pulled his groin trying to slide into home plate, told everyone: I broke my leg muscle playing baseball.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 24, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy, do I go to school today? Dave: Yes. Dwyane: Do I have to get dressed first? Dave: Of course. Dwyane: Why?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 23, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, you’re my precious.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 20, 2016
item.description: Dave: Ashley, why are you outside in just your socks? Ashley: I forgot I had socks on.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 19, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Sometimes my cheeks hurt when I smile that good!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 18, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Daddy? Dave: What? Dwyane: Daddy? Dave: What? Dwyane: Daddy? Dave: What do you want? Dwyane: Why you keep saying “What” Daddy? Hahahahaha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 17, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Happy birthday to me! I’m a birthday cake boy!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 16, 2016
item.description: Eating out at Casa Brava’s I told Dillan: You’re a mamma’s boy! Ashley piped up: I’m a drama queen!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 13, 2016
item.description: The kids were singing “Jesus Loves Me” on the way to daycare when Bruce said: Jesus died. The Easter Bunny got him.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 12, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Can you take a picture of that sunrise? Dave: No. You can remember the sunrise in your head. Ashley: I can’t! I can barely remember anything! Dillan: I can’t remember anything either. I can’t even remember my birthday. Ashley: Me either!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 11, 2016
item.description: Dave, to Ashley: Ashley, put a lid on that talking. Ashley: I don’t know how. Dave: it means to stop talking for awhile. Ashley: I don’t know how.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 10, 2016
item.description: Dillan: You’re my daddy, Daddy. Even if I don’t live with you anymore you’ll always be my daddy!”

item.title: Last Kid Quote of the Day – May 9, 2016
item.description: My niece Sarah Mae starts her new career with DCS on May 31 and as such she has decided it is now her responsibility to police my Kid Quotes. She considers them dangerous and too personal to be put on Facebook. Since I already have four kids and don’t want the drama of a fifth child, I have decided to suspend my Facebook Kid Quotes indefinitely. I will still keep them for us and the kids, I’m just not going to post them on Facebook any longer.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 6, 2016
item.description: [I was in the truck getting ready to leave to take the big kids shopping for Dillan’s camping equipment.] Dillan wanted it to be a big guys only night with no girls so he said to Ashley: Ashley, you should stay home. You’re going to miss popcorn. And TV. And lemonade. Ashley thought for a minute and said: Daddy, is it okay if I don’t go? I’m kind of tired and think I should stay home.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 5, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Whoa! My penis moved!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 4, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Mommy! Let me guess what we’re having for dinner. Hmmmm, what are we having for dinner? Lesa: Hamburger Helper. Ashley: Yaaaaaa! I LOVE Hamburger Helper! Dwyane: Me hungry! What we having for lunch Mommy? Lesa: You mean dinner, Dwyane. Dwyane: What we having for dinner Mommy? Lesa: Hamburger Helper. Dwyane: Yaaaaa! Me like Hamburger Helper! Dillan: What are we having for dinner, Mommy? Lesa: Hamburger Helper. Dillan: Alright!!! I like Hamburger Helper!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 3, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I only like three boys: God, Jesus and Dave. And I only like one girl: Lesa.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – May 2, 2016
item.description: Dwyane: Mommy, me tired. I worked hard at preschool today! (BOHOF)

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 28, 2016
item.description: [Bruce couldn’t reach the light switch so Dwyane jumped and was able to flip the light switch on.] Bruce: Dwyane, you’re my superhero! Dwyane: I’m not a superhero. Bruce: Uh-huh!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 27, 2016
item.description: [Dwyane and Bruce watched the bees buzzing around Lesa’s flowers with her one day last week and she had told them the bees were collecting nectar to make honey.] Bruce, talking about a bumble bee flying around the deck, told Lesa: The bees are trying to make honey from us, but I ducked!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 26, 2016
item.description: Old Guy Losing His Mind Quote of the Day: Dave, to Ashley: Quit scratching that poison ivy or it will spread! Ashley, wanting to itch, and in a smart-aleck tone: How do you know? Dave, exasperated: ‘Cause I’m 54 and I’ve had poison ivy more times than you’ve been born! [While technically true I meant to say more times than you can count.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 25, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Can I get a taste of that wine? Dave: Sure, but you won’t like it. [I let her have a sip.] Ashley, scrunched up her face and said: Eeww! I don’t like it! Dave: I told you you wouldn’t like it. Ashley, after about a minute: Can I have some more? Dave: No! You still won’t like it. Besides, Mommy would kill me if she knew I was letting you taste wine.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 22, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I’m tired. Dave: Me too! Dillan: Me three. Dwyane: Me four. Bruce: Me four! Dillan: Bruce, there’s four kids and Daddy already said. Bruce: Me five!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 21, 2016
item.description: Dave: Whatcha doing Ashley? Ashley: I’m drawing your big belly Daddy. Dave: You’re gonna need more supplies.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 20, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Mommy, your whole name is Lesa Gaye Williams. Lesa: I’m surprised you remembered that! Ashley: And mine is Ashley Lynn Moffett. Lesa: Yes it is. Dillan: And mine is Dillan Levi Moffett and Daddy’s is David Ernest Williams. Lesa: Wow! You remembered that! Bruce: I’m Brucie Moffett! And mommy’s name is Mommy Lesa Moffett!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 19, 2016
item.description: When Marcy Cook said we would have chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room, Ashley told her: My mommy makes the best strawberry shortcake!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 18, 2016
item.description: Dave: Man, the house stinks! Lesa: It does? How? Dave: It smells like poop. Dwyane: Excuse me Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 15, 2016
item.description: Ashley, to Dave: It makes me happy when I can hug and kiss you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 14, 2016
item.description: Dwyane, wearing his new light-up Spider-Man shoes, said: When I grow up I’m going to be Spider-Man and wear Spider-Man shoes!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 13, 2016
item.description: After days and days of rain and clouds, Ashley asked Lesa: What’s that? Lesa: The sun.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 12, 2016
item.description: [The kids were worried about witches making cars and trucks disappear so they can eat the kids inside.] Ashley: I will kick them and run away! Dwyane: Me run away! Very fast! Dillan: I will punch them. And kick them in the butt! Bruce: They don’t have butts. I poop on them. They go away then.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 11, 2016
item.description: Jenny Stinson came into my Sunday School classroom yesterday with her hand closed like she had something in it, and said: Hold out your hand. [I held my hand out.] Jenny said: It’s a kiss from Dwyane!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 8, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Walking witches will turn you into frogs. Dave: Witches will turn you into frogs? Bruce: Walking witches. Dave: Walking witches? What’s a walking witch? Ashley: Dave! It’s a witch that doesn’t have a broom and can’t fly yet. It has to walk! Dave: Bruce, you better watch out for them walking witches and if you see one you better be nice! Bruce: Where? Where’s a walking witch? Dave: I don’t see one but if you ever do you better watch out!

item.title: Dad Quote of the Day – April 7, 2016
item.description: The kids were giggling and singing old McDonald instead of eating breakfast, so I sang this: Big ol’ Daddy had a farm, E-I-E-I-O. And on his farm he had some breakfast! E-I-E-I-O. Eat your breakfast here! Eat your breakfast there! Eat your breakfast, eat your breakfast, Eat your breakfast everywhere! Big ol’ Daddy had a farm, E-I-E-I-O. [The kids thought it was hilarious and burst out laughing.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 6, 2016
item.description: After lifting Bruce high enough to touch the ceiling, Dave said: That was high! I can’t even touch the ceiling. Bruce: You have to wait to get bigger like me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 5, 2016
item.description: Dave: Why are all our kids running around the house naked? Lesa: I don’t know. Bruce and Dwyane: Naked boy! Naked boy! Ashley: Naked girl! Dillan: I’m not naked. Dave: Thank goodness!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 4, 2016
item.description: Lesa to Bruce regarding the Wicked Witch of the West walking down the train asile: I thought she was dead. Aren’t you afraid of her? Bruce, calm as could be, replied: No, she died but came back nice.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – April 1, 2016
item.description: Driving to daycare passing some random house, Bruce whispered: That’s a witchy house. Be quiet. Dwyane, also whispering: No. That’s a ghost house. Bruce: It’s a witchy house! Dwyane: You a witch! Witchy Bruce Moffett. Bruce: No! I’m Brucie Moffett! You a witch! Dwyane: No. Me a ghost. Bruce, whispering again: Be quiet. They might hear us. Dwyane, whispering again: Okay, let’s be quiet. Five minutes later when it was noisy again in the truck, Dave whispered: There’s another witch’s house.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 31, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I named my belly Mia Rosie Cozy because it is soft and cozy and snuggles up with me at night!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 30, 2016
item.description: Ashley, at dinner: Maybe some husbands could cook so little girls’ mommies can play with them because they only have brothers and no other girls to play with? Ashley: Or maybe some other girl who’s mommy and daddy doesn’t take care of her and be nice to her can find nice people to take care of her. And then those nice people can take one of the boys [she looks at Dillan] and send to other nice people and then it would be even – two girls and two boys.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 29, 2016
item.description: Bruce, in potty training, animated and obviously excited, said: Daddy! Come look at my pee! Me a big boy now!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 28, 2016
item.description: [After getting dressed up for church …] Dwyane looked at Bruce and said: Handsome. Bruce looked at Dwyane and said: Handsome. [… and then they hugged each other.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 25, 2016
item.description: Dillan: Dwyane, you’re dead. You go sit over there. You can’t play anymore. Dwyane: But I don’t want to be dead.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 24, 2016
item.description: Ashley, to the boys: You can not come into my room! Only Dave and Lesa and God and Jesus can come into my room.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 23, 2016
item.description: Ashley: My real name is Princess Drama Queen Ashley Lynn Moffett Williams.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 22, 2016
item.description: Ashley, a little confused about late at night: We got home late early.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 21, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Mommy, can you take my head off so I can see my back?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 18, 2016
item.description: [After an awesome dinner and respite with our friends Michelle and Ray Hausler.] Dwyane said: Mommy, that was fun! Dillan: Yeah, that was fun! Ashley: Can we go back again someday? On a Saturday? Dave: Sure, we can go back again. Bruce, did you have fun too? Bruce: Yeah.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 17, 2016
item.description: Dave: Maybe I should dye my hair a little bit brown so I don’t look so old and gray? Ashley: No Daddy. I like the way you are – and the way you look!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 16, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I’m going to marry little Logan at daycare. Dave: ONLY if I approve of him first young lady! Ashley: But Daddy! He’s nice to me. And he let me play with his toys – all day! Dave, stammering: Yeah, but, but, but will he treat you right, and take care of you, and provide for you and your family? Ashley: I will help him. I’ll cook supper for him when he gets home!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 15, 2016
item.description: Last week Ashley lost her tooth at school and when we got home she ran into the house and said: Mommy, look at my loose tooth! Lesa: No, I don’t want to look at your loose tooth, it makes me sick to my stomach seeing you move that around in your mouth. Ashley: Pretty please with sugar on top???? I promise you won’t get sick! Lesa: Okay. Ashley dancing with joy: It fell out!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 14, 2016
item.description: [Lesa took a flight to see her mom in Wisconsin on Sunday morning. A few of the things I’ve heard since she left.] Dillan, feeling anxious and needing reassurance with lots of hugs: My Daddy! You’re my Daddy! Ashley: I miss Mommy. It’s going to be a long four days! Dwyane: I really miss Mommy. A lot! Bruce, thinking Lesa is still on the plane: Why Mommy still in that plane?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 11, 2016
item.description: [At Dwyane’s Parent Teacher Conference his teacher said he was their “model” child in class.] Dwyane in a real low hushed tone: Mommy, me not good ALL the time at school. Lesa: I kind of figured that, but you know, I’m not good at work all the time either. It’s hard to be good all the time. Dwyane: Yes it is.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 10, 2016
item.description: Ashley: There was little white leprechaun tracks going past each trap bringing toys and stuff. Dillan: That was Mrs. Dillman. She was trying to trick you. Ashley: No! She wouldn’t do that to us! She’s not a liar! Leprechauns can be for real!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 9, 2016
item.description: [Each evening before we reach the top of our hill on our way home from daycare we try to guess whether or not we beat Lesa home.] Dave: I say Lesa’s home. Dillan: She’s home. Dwyane, who always picks the opposite of Dillan, said: She’s not home. Ashley: She’s not home, she’s not home, she’s not home! Dave: What do you think Bruce? Bruce: Home. Dave: Okay, three say she’s home, two say she’s not home.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 8, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I hate it when they put hills by the road ’cause I can’t see the fields.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 7, 2016
item.description: Dave: Who got all of Dwyane and Ashley’s stuff out and made a mess of it? Bruce: Me did Daddy – because I’m mean. Dave: Well, take your mean self over there and pick it up. Bruce: Okay Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 4, 2016
item.description: Dillan, doing flashcard addition practice on the computer: Daddy, I got three in a row using just my brain! Is that good? Dave: Good job Dillan! Keep going!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 3, 2016
item.description: Bruce: What Mommy? Lesa: Nothing Bruce. I was just talking to Daddy. Bruce: Why? Dave: Because she likes talking to adults every once in a while. Bruce: No way!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 2, 2016
item.description: Dillan, cleaning up his mess on the floor: Oh, my aching back, it hurts so bad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – March 1, 2016
item.description: Dave, pulling out of the driveway: I count six deer in our yard. Dillan: Yeah, one is a boy deer. Ashley: Oh, I didn’t get to see. Bruce: Daddy, go back! I want to say “Hi!” to those deer.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 29, 2016
item.description: In the truck it was getting kind of loud. Ashley said: 1, 2, 3 quiet as a mouse! [A chorus of noise just erupted!] Dwyane: What? What Ashley? Ashley? Ashley? ASHLEY! What did you say? Bruce: Mouse! MOUSE! MOUSE!! BE QUIET MOUSE! Dillan: Daddy, Ashley is telling me what to do. She said be quiet. Ashley’s being annoying. Daddy? Daddy? Ashley STOP! You’re not the boss over me! Ashley: I said 1, 2, 3 QUIET AS A MOUSE!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 26, 2016
item.description: Yesterday, a really concerned Bruce said: Mommy, you forgot to give Daddy kisses. Lesa: I know but I gave him some today. Bruce: You gave him two but you’re supposed to give him three. Lesa: Okay, I’ll make sure I give him three kisses tomorrow. Bruce: Okay. [Lesa gave me three kisses today while Bruce watched. At three he broke out into the biggest grin – all is well in his world.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 25, 2016
item.description: [Amber from Open Arms was babysitting the kids for us last Friday so we could finally go out to dinner together. Thank you, thank you, thank you! During the same time Stephanie from DCS made an unannounced visit which caused anxiety for the kids, and us.] Ashley to Stephanie during her visit: Dave and Lesa are eating out. I hope they have a happy meal! Ashley to Dave after Stephanie’s visit: If Amber or Stephanie come to our house and want to take us away I will hold onto you so tight they will never be able to get me!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 24, 2016
item.description: Ashley, as I tucked her into bed last night: You can tell Mommy she’s the only beautiful girl in the whole world!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 23, 2016
item.description: Lesa: Since you guys are always picking your nose and eating your boogers maybe I should buy some of those booger flavored jelly beans for you. Dillan: No. Ashley: Yucky. Dwyane: I like boogers. Bruce: Me too.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 22, 2016
item.description: [I have several good quotes to share and I will later. I have quotes certain to bring a smile and get lots of likes. I was going to pick from one of those this morning because it’s a Monday and everyone needs a pick-me-up on a Monday morning. But I’m not going to pick one of those, I’m going to share this morning’s breakfast talk instead. Here is the conversation between Ashley (5 years old) and Bruce (2 years old) while eating their Cheerios.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 19, 2016
item.description: Dillan to Lesa: I wish that judge would make up his mind so I can stay with you forever!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 18, 2016
item.description: Ashley to Dave: You can have some of my SweetTarts cause you’re my sweet heart! Hahahahaha!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 17, 2016
item.description: Dave: I have to go to work just to get some peace and quiet. Dwyane: Yeah, me too!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 16, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Can you take me to the place with all the medicine [CVS] so I can get you Valentines stuff? But you can’t look! Dave: Well, who is going to pay for it then? Ashley: You are! But you can’t look!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 15, 2016
item.description: Bruce: I broke my butt ice skating.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 12, 2016
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, did you have a sister? Dave: Yes, she died. Dillan: So you were a Dad and a brother? Dave: I still am. I’m a dad to you guys and I have a brother James and Avery and a sister Kristie AND I’m a husband too. Dillan: Do I know them? Dave: Yes, you saw them at Christmas. Dillan: Oh yeah. Dillan: Why did your sister die? Dave: She had cancer.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 11, 2016
item.description: Pauline, one of Dillan’s Sunday School teachers, told me when asked during Junior Church who his hero was, Dillan said: Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 10, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I hope you live long enough to see my babies. Dave: Me too! I’d really like to see you grow into a young woman. Ashley: I will have three babies, two girls and one boy, and I will learn to drive and then bring my babies to your house. Dave: Well, I certainly hope you learn to drive first before you start having babies. Ashley: Me and my babies can live with you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 9, 2016
item.description: Ashley, during the Father/Daughter Dance in Bedford last Friday: Daddy, thank you for taking me here. It is the best day ever!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 8, 2016
item.description: Ashley: I hope I don’t ever have to leave. Dave: Me too! Ashley: If I do when I get older I will drive to come see you! Dave: Please, please do! You will be able to find us if you look. Ashley: And if you died I will visit your grave and cry for you. Dave: If that happens try to remember that I loved you and don’t cry too hard, okay?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 5, 2016
item.description: Dave, vexed: Bruce, Bruce, Bruce. Bruce: Daddy, Daddy, Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 4, 2016
item.description: Ashley: If I lived in a snowglobe I would yell to get out!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 3, 2016
item.description: Ashley: Daddy, I love you so much. I love you to infinity plus infinity! Dave: I love you too. I hope you will still love me when you get older. Ashley: I will always love you! Dave: Some kids when they grow up might not like their mom and dad if it’s not their real mom and dad. Ashley: You are my dad forever. Dave: I believe you love me now.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 2, 2016
item.description: [Dillan got so excited at Monster Jam he was literally sitting on the edge of his seat and actually toppled off it three times – once into the kid in the row below us!] Dillan, over and over again: Daddy! Did you see that! Wasn’t that awesome! Dave, over and over again: Yes Dillan, that was awesome.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 1, 2016
item.description: Ashley talking about Becky McDonough, the driver of El Toro Loco, at Monster Jam 2016: Daddy, she is a good driver and very pretty but Mommy is even more prettier than her. http://www.beckymcdonough.com/ https://www.monsterjam.com/drivers/becky-mcdonough

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 29, 2016
item.description: During Junior Church last Sunday when the kids were asked if they had anything to thank God for in prayer, Ashley raised her hand and said: God brought us to Dave and Lesa’s house.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 28, 2016
item.description: [Ashley stayed home with me all afternoon. At dinner we did the “How was your day?” routine.] Ashley: Mommy? How was your day? Lesa: I had to work but it was good for the most part. Ashley: My day was good too. Ashley: Daddy? How was your day? Wait, I already know. Your day with me was great! Ashley: Dillan? How was your day?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 27, 2016
item.description: Bruce: Where’s Mommy? Dave: She’s at work. Bruce: Why? Dave: So we can have enough money to keep you. Bruce: I love Mommy. Dave: I do too. I think everyone in this truck loves Mommy. She’s a good Mommy and a good wife. Ashley: You said it! Dillan: Yeah! Ashley: Daddy, you said “Mommy was a good Mommy” and I said “you said it.” Isn’t that funny?

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 26, 2016
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, we were supposed to be your kids a year ago, right? Dave: Yes, you were supposed to be, but Stephanie made a mistake and so we had to wait until this year. Dillan: And then she made another mistake, right Daddy? Dave: That’s right Dillan. And now we don’t know what will happen. Dillan: My Daddy! Dave: My Dillan!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – January 25, 2016
