item.description: Ashley, going into speech therapy: Are you going with me? Dave: Yes. No need to be afraid. Ashley: You can say that again. [ … a few seconds later … ] Ashley: YOU CAN SAY THAT AGAIN! Dave: Oh, okay. No need to be afraid. Ashley: Okay Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 9, 2014
item.description: Dillan: I don’t want to go out because the sun is yellow. Dave: So, you don’t want to go to the park? Dillan: The park? Yeah! I didn’t know we was going to the park! Dave: But the sun will still be yellow. How come you want to go out when we’re going to the park but not when we’re at home? Dillan: You don’t have play sets and slides!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 8, 2014
item.description: [DISCLAIMER: Gross content follows!] Ashley: Sometimes you throw up when you’re sick but not all the time. Dave: Did you throw up? Ashley: I think I did. Dave: In the toilet? Ashley: No. I threw up on the rug and my pants and my foot. Sometimes throw up is too fast for me. Dave: Okay, we’ll be right there. Ashley: I’ll wait here until the rest comes out. Dave: Please do!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 5, 2014
item.description: Dillan, who doesn’t like eggs, commenting on my breakfast: Your eggs smell funny and taste bad. Dave: I don’t think they smell and besides, not everything that smells bad, tastes bad. Dillan: Like what? Dave: Well, like cheese or cabbage. Ashley: I smell bad and taste good.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 4, 2014
item.description: Ashley, looking out the front door as Lesa and Dillan were leaving this morning: Bye Mommy. Bye Bubby. Have a fun day at work Mommy. Have a fun day at school Bubby. Love you Mommy. Dave: Don’t you love Dillan too? Ashley: No! Dillan is my brother!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 3, 2014
item.description: Ashley: Can I watch TV? Dave: No. Ashley: Sometimes my eyes don’t know what to do so they want to watch TV.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 2, 2014
item.description: Ashley, while eating: Dave, I’m not going to talk while eating because you will tell me to quit talking and eat so me won’t talk … and I is hungry and if I talk I won’t be able to eat fast and then I’ll be more hungry … and this food you fixed is yummy … and I is little so me needs to eat a lot to be big and I want to be so big so me will eat and not talk … and if I don’t eat then me won’t get desert and I want to eat desert because me like eating desert sooooo much … and my tummy will rumble if I don’t eat … and then my tummy will rumble at nap time and then I won’t sleep because my tummy is rumbling … and if I don’t eat and sleep me will get sick and have to go to bed early … and then I won’t be able to go out and play until I’m done eating cause I is sick and I like going out to play with those kids so me will hurry and eat … and Dave: Ashley, quit talking and eat.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 29, 2014
item.description: Dillan: Daddy, I like your muscles.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 28, 2014
item.description: Dillan, whispering into Lesa’s ear: You’re my Lesa! Lesa, whispering into Dillan’s ear: You’re my Dillan!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 27, 2014
item.description: Ashley: What does that say? Dave: I can’t read it from here. Ashley: I can read it. Dave: Then why did you ask me what it said? Ashley: You’re silly!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 26, 2014
item.description: Ashley: What’s in your hand? Dave: Peanut butter crackers. Ashley: I like peanut butter crackers. Dave: You do? Ashley: Daddy, can I tell you something? Dave: Sure. Ashley: I love you. Dave: You’re just saying that to get some crackers. Ashley: But my tummy is rumbling! Dave: You just had breakfast. This is my breakfast. If I give you my crackers my tummy will rumble. Ashley: Awe! But I want crackers.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 25, 2014
item.description: Dillan, after farting this morning: Wow Daddy Dave. Did you hear that? Dave: Yes I did! Dillan: Was that a loud one? Dave: Yes it was! Dillan: Louder than you even? Dave: Yes, louder than me even. Dillan: That’s because I’m getting bigger!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 22, 2014
item.description: Dillan, in a demanding tone: Where’s Lesa? Dave: Why? What do you need her for? Dillan: I’m being nosy. [Snickers] Dave: Yes you are. Maybe she’s out getting less nosy kids. Dillan: Daddy Dave! That’s mean! Dave: You’re right, that was mean. I’m sorry. Ashley: You don’t know those new kids’ houses so you can’t go there, and you got us so now you have to keep us, and, and, and I will miss you!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 21, 2014
item.description: [This conversation was about Ashley wanting to let Lesa know when day care was having chocolate milk for lunch…] Lesa to Ashley: Well, maybe you can call and let me know? Ashley: I’m a kid, and Daddy Dave says phones are for adults, and I’m not an adult because I’m a kid, so I can’t call and tell you. Maybe you can just buy chocolate milk!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 20, 2014
item.description: Ashley to Dillan as he was leaving for kindergarten: Bubby! Hug! [They hug.] Ashley to Dave after Dillan leaves: Dillan likes me. I wish I was big like 5 year olds so I could go to school with Dillan.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 19, 2014
item.description: Dave and Lesa to Ashley and Dillan: There will be a day when Dillan will like girls and Ashley will like boys. Dillan: Yuck! I like boys. Ashley: I will never like boys! I will call them names!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 18, 2014
item.description: Dave to Ashley: I thought you said you were hungry? Ashley: I didn’t know we was having broccoli.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 15, 2014
item.description: Ashley: I was sleeping and talking to Dillan at the same time. Silly me.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 14, 2014
item.description: Ashley: They didn’t have girl Band-Aids – only boy Band-Aids – but it’s Spider-Man so it’s okay.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 13, 2014
item.description: Dillan, after seeing his first theater movie: That’s my favorite movie!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 12, 2014
item.description: Ashley, while putting her dolls to bed, says to Lesa: When I grow up I want two babies, and I’ll never leave them like my mommy left me. [Disclaimer: Ashley did not hear this from us. It is something she worked out on her own.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 11, 2014
item.description: Ashley to Dave: Are we home yet ’cause I want to hug Mommy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 8, 2014
item.description: At his kindergarten meet and greet, while hiding behind my legs, Dillan says: I’m not really scared and afraid – I’m being shy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 6, 2014
item.description: Dave: Ashley, didn’t you hear me ask you to pick up your toys? Ashley: No Daddy. My ears are too small and filled up to hear.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 5, 2014
item.description: Dillan: I saw a police car in that driveway! Dave: That’s where he lives. Do you want to be a policeman? Dillan: No! Dave: A fireman? Dillan: No! Dave: Well, what do you want to be when you grow up? Dillan: I want to be like Daddy Dave! Dave: Wow! Thanks! You could set you sights a little higher and be better than me. Ashley: I want to be a princess like Mommy Lesa!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 4, 2014
item.description: Ashley said to Lesa Williams at dinner last night: You’re my best mommy and Daddy is my best daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 1, 2014
item.description: Ashley, standing in line for a balloon animal: I want a pink frog or a green bunny. [She picked the pink frog.]

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 31, 2014
item.description: Dillan: Do you have a toothbrush? Dave: Yes. Dillan: Is it blue? Dave: Yes it is. Dillan: Does it have trucks on it too? Dave: No, no trucks. Dillan: Can I see it? Dave: Sure. [I go get my toothbrush.] Dillan: Wow! That’s a big toothbrush!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 30, 2014
item.description: Ashley talking about Dillan going to kindergarten: But me will miss Dilly! Me will miss Daddy too! Me will be alone at daycare! Me will die!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 29, 2014
item.description: Lesa, to Dillan: What’s your favorite food? Dillan: Pizza! Lesa, to Ashley: What’s your favorite food? Ashley: Pizza macaroni and cheese cake! Dillan to Ashley: That sounds yummy!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 28, 2014
item.description: Ashley, negotiating for toys: I will be your friend forever. When that didn’t work: I will be nice to you. Lesa Williams: Yeah, but for how long? Ashley: Three minutes! Lesa: That’s not very long. Ashley: Okay, okay. One minute!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 26, 2014
item.description: Ashley, who loves and wants a rabbit: Did you see that bunny!?! Dave: Yes, but that kind of rabbit you can’t pick up and pet. Dillan: Yeah, that rabbit will kill you and eat you up! Ashley: Ohh!!!!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 25, 2014
item.description: Dillan: Wow Daddy! Did you hear that car? Dave: Yes, he wants everyone to look at his car. Dillan: When I grow up my truck will be very very very very very very very very very very very very very … very very very very very very very very very very very very very loud so everyone will hear me. That’s a lot of loud!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 24, 2014
item.description: While eating supper Ashley says: Mommy, can I tell you something? Lesa Williams: Yes. Ashley: I think I love you a whole lot!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 22, 2014
item.description: Dwyane: Hi Daddy.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 21, 2014
item.description: Dillan: You need to buy a new house Ashley: ‘Cause this one’s too small!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 18, 2014
item.description: Dwyane, standing in the tub, said “Me pee.”

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 17, 2014
item.description: Tired Bruce: Waaah waaah wah wah waaaaaaaaaah! Hungry Bruce: Waaah waaah wah wah waaaaaaaaaah! Needs changed Bruce: Waaah waaah wah wah waaaaaaaaaah! Wants attention Bruce: Waaah waaah wah wah waaaaaaaaaah! Normal Bruce: Waaah waaah wah wah waaaaaaaaaah!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 16, 2014
item.description: Dillan: You like that truck Daddy? Dave: Yes I do. Dillan: I buy you that truck. A blue one. Ashley, in the background: Me buy Mommy a pink one.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 15, 2014
item.description: After seeing a picture of Jesus in one of her books Ashley said, “Me saw Jesus! Me kissed Jesus! Me love Jesus so much!”

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 14, 2014
item.description: Dillan, when asked what his name was at the new day care: I’m Dillan. I’m big brother. I make sure no one beats up on Ashley.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 12, 2014
item.description: Ashley: We’re bad luck kids. No one wants us anymore.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 11, 2014
item.description: Ashley: You and mommy are very old and will die soon. Me be very sad. Me will climb on me bed and wait for you to come back!

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 10, 2014
item.description: “Rrrhhhaaaaaaallllllllllkkkkkk” – what Bruce said when he walked up to me and barfed banana and Cheerios on my shirt and pants while I was getting ready for work. He just smiled, laughed, and walked away…

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – July 9, 2014
item.description: Dillan, during breakfast, out of nowhere: Mommy pooped Bruce out. Dave: Well, that would explain a lot.
